commit_message:
Remove testrepository and .testr.conf

This commit is a follow-up of "switch to using stestr"
which was merged already [1].
After switch to using stestr, testrepository and .testr.conf
are unnecessary and should be removed.

This patch also switch "test" to "stestr" for coverage jobs.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/575854

Change-Id: I2f2a50a4b0b2e11f21f8ab2995d951aee170a68b

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: Ic64bbfcafc0a2597d83081257274daf5d3d4a447

commit_message:
Avoid empty raise

Re-raise entrypoint loading error by hand to make the
code more readable.

Change-Id: Ifcfaf74ffaeb6baad892de4187482eb5beabdc3f

commit_message:
Add chrony time service

Add a chrony service configuration. The chrony service configuration
includes tasks to ensure that the ntpd service is stopped prior to
configuring chronyd. Since both can be switched back and forth, the ntpd
configuration is also updated to stop chronyd prior to attemping to
configure the ntpd service.

Change-Id: Ie5e8183c000915f28166c842cecc04f445c013ae
Related-Blueprint: tripleo-chrony

commit_message:
In default mode , disable "debug"

In default mode, Debug is disable in devstack.

If necessary, enable it by self .

Change-Id: I23f190c7f69015694be11dec6f532ddf5ebfeb10

[{'created': '2018-10-09 03:23:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I2cbe562fee0983715b610ef35e2d4c569499313f
"}, {'created': '2018-10-22 01:08:04.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I2cbe562fee0983715b610ef35e2d4c569499313f
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: I2cbe562fee0983715b610ef35e2d4c569499313f

[{'created': '2018-10-30 18:30:28.000000000', 'message': "Server overview: display hypervisor name if available

right since the default nova-api policy doesn't return the hypervisor
if you don't have the admin priv.

But, since there is a modifiable policy enforced by the api,

commit_message:
Server overview: display hypervisor name if available

Previously this had a check for is_superuser.  That's sort of
right since the default nova-api policy doesn't return the hypervisor
if you don't have the admin priv.

But, since there is a modifiable policy enforced by the api,
let's just let that decide.  If nova-api returns the hypervisor,
presumably it has decided that we're allowed to see it, so let's
see it!

Change-Id: I0cfe9090e8263f983fa5f42f42616a26407be47a

commit_message:
Only install monotonic on python2

monotonic is a backport of time.monotonic from python3. Only install it
for python2.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615441
Change-Id: Id27cd748e883d54dd93dac2e6bd8caee6728f7e1

commit_message:
Fixup functions for 5.5.7+

Recent changes to Puppet (5.5.7+) has broken some of the legacy function
items we were doing in puppet-nova. We'll likely need to update all the
functions to the new syntax but for now this change is to address
current issues.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614143/
Change-Id: If1d675cec6fe64e8a812fb638078b0ab1c66b5de
Closes-Bug: #1799757
(cherry picked from commit 3d877926f09d9c0c0f331025256c4b55214c1269)

commit_message:
Always enable the Ceph repos when deploying master

From the Rocky release we need to enable the Ceph repos to make
sure we can install ceph-ansible on the undercloud.

Change-Id: I440a598a3aeeadc5a50073e260c7cb19ce49dc26

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.
Update to reflect reality, which should help with local running of
constraints targets.

Change-Id: I343da220ef68a56448042046bf644b964ef71f62

So that we have more information when they fail.

Change-Id: I3b149cf3466584e4592dba716096931ec32a4e90

commit_message:
Update backup flow for CephBackupDriver

Following the latest documentation, we should
configure  class for backup_driver[1].

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/cinder/latest/configuration/block-storage/backup/ceph-backup-driver.html

Change-Id: I10f8eaa51d059e65ddff959b81f09cb90a065fdd

commit_message:
Fix startdash and startpanel management commands

During startdash and startpanel commands execution Django loads base
templates and tries to compile them. We need to use templatetag [1] to
avoid this behaviour.

As alternative solution we can use verbatim [2] block for it but it
makes our base tamplets less readable, IMO.

[1] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/templates/builtins/#templatetag
[2] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/templates/builtins/#std:templatetag-verbatim

Change-Id: I1a489d4d4210e9c72d138cff9bfee664d424be20
Closes-Bug: #1796312

commit_message:
Correct shyaml installation on fedora28

Fixed failure to install a working version of shyaml on fedora28 where
shyaml was installed but not functioning because python3-yaml was
not installed.

Also fix problem that caused installation of python2 packages on
python3 systems due to the wildcards, we removed the wildcards.

Also removed single quoates from exclude param because bash did
escape them, which probably caused the excludes to be ignored.

See http://logs.openstack.org/16/614516/2/check/tripleo-ci-fedora-28-standalone/7b10b3a/job-output.txt.gz#_2018-11-01_15_05_51_598966

File "/usr/bin/shyaml", line 11, in <module>
import yaml
ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'yaml'

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/614762

Change-Id: I0ffe2af9bc56d4185e2ad16dd1800bf028070414

detected on the system.

commit_message:
make quickstart.sh rpm pip/virtualenv optional

Solved failure to install on nodepool nodes which had both packages
installed but also excluded in yum.conf/dnf.conf file.

New code would try to install these rpms only if the tools are not
detected on the system.

Change-Id: I9f39d62065bbf8bf9f533375a9392a2e636d60f5
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/68

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-26 16:57:58.000000000', 'message': 'Allow to start UT with Django 2.1

In Django 2.1, string_concat() was removed in favor of format_lazy().
Attribute level import of string_concat prevents from loading
openstack_dashboard UT. This commit replaces string_concat() with
format_lazy().

Note that there are a number of breakage with Django 2.1
and they need to be tackled as the horizon community
including the support plan of Django itself.

Change-Id: I5ab8f2b25ca399e1d2815ddfa36dffb5260a591a
Closes-Bug: #1789046
'}]
commit_message:
Allow to start UT with Django 2.1

In Django 2.1, string_concat() was removed in favor of format_lazy().
Attribute level import of string_concat prevents from loading
openstack_dashboard UT. This commit replaces string_concat() with
format_lazy().

Note that there are a number of breakage with Django 2.1
and they need to be tackled as the horizon community
including the support plan of Django itself.

Change-Id: I5ab8f2b25ca399e1d2815ddfa36dffb5260a591a
Closes-Bug: #1789046

commit_message:
Avoid including nova_virt_detect if nova_virt_type is set

There's no need for us to actually run through that entire
set of tasks if the value is specified already.

Change-Id: I6f3503fdfbe8fa43334da4360827078cd450ffcd

commit_message:
Documentation fix - Port number

Small fix on documentation, replacing port "35357" and
"keystone-wsgi-admin" by port "5000" and "keystone-wsgi-public".

Based on an online discussion with Colleen with the removal of the v2
API the project no longer recommends using a special port or the
admin application.

Change-Id: I953b071c41e37ddf63f00f6feaf54d4185a17734

"}, {'created': '2018-11-04 06:43:49.000000000', 'message': "Stop creating duplicate lines in lxc config files

The 'Ensure containers have access RO cgroups' will currently add the
same line to an lxc container's config file on every run of the role.

Add a regular expression to the task to check if the line to be inserted

Change-Id: I5ac57bd59ea943c019dd0a5530c8246284b33269
"}]
commit_message:
Stop creating duplicate lines in lxc config files

The 'Ensure containers have access RO cgroups' will currently add the
same line to an lxc container's config file on every run of the role.

Add a regular expression to the task to check if the line to be inserted
already exists in the file, and if so, don't insert it again.

Change-Id: I5ac57bd59ea943c019dd0a5530c8246284b33269

Change-Id: I9ad252eee056762fbaacb68f673d07a24329947f
'}, {'created': '2018-11-04 06:34:35.000000000', 'message': 'Increase the sleep to 30 sec for discover_hosts in Nova

commit_message:
Increase the sleep to 30 sec for discover_hosts in Nova

* Earlier the sleep was 10 sec, till that time nova-compute does
  not startup and register itself in these 10 seconds which leads
  to race condition while tempest tests. Increasing sleep will fix
  the issue.

Change-Id: I9ad252eee056762fbaacb68f673d07a24329947f

commit_message:
Mechanism driver API: resource_provider_uuid5_namespace

A UUID v5 namespace for mechanism drivers wanting to report resource
providers to Placement.

commit_message:
Restrict contextlib2 to only python2

contextlib2 is a backport library of python3's contextlib. Let's only
install it in python2.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/580481
Change-Id: I7e88b76d55d5310bb067903c08aa6951e14ae197

commit_message:
Use openstackclient instead of neutronclient

The python-neutronclient is deprecated and under maintain.
All CLI users should switch to openstackclient instead.

Change-Id: I87e0b4501c198d7cccd5350424a01c6afb3a2836

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-21 15:30:25.000000000', 'message': "Add cells v1 deprecation notice and remove broken code

In Nova cells v1 has been deprecated since Ocata but we
have no notices about it. This adds warnings about it
being deprecated and will be removed.

The functionality in nova::cells when passing create_cells
parameter is broken and has therefore been removed and
instead outputs a warning and is deprecated.

A known issue has been added to the release notes to inform
about this. It's probably safe to say that nobody is using it
since it has been broken since we switched over to transport_url
for rabbit, it's also safe to probably assume that no deployments
that run cell v1 right now will be running a later version of Nova.

Change-Id: I564fc4f43a752b051280dce095a52ca4d477fb09

commit_message:
Add cells v1 deprecation notice and remove broken code

In Nova cells v1 has been deprecated since Ocata but we
have no notices about it. This adds warnings about it
being deprecated and will be removed.

The functionality in nova::cells when passing create_cells
parameter is broken and has therefore been removed and
instead outputs a warning and is deprecated.

A known issue has been added to the release notes to inform
about this. It's probably safe to say that nobody is using it
since it has been broken since we switched over to transport_url
for rabbit, it's also safe to probably assume that no deployments
that run cell v1 right now will be running a later version of Nova.

Closes-Bug: 1687395
Change-Id: I564fc4f43a752b051280dce095a52ca4d477fb09

commit_message:
Blacklist tempest_horizon.tests test in Scenario003 CI

* tempest_horizon.tests.scenario.test_dashboard_basic_ops
  .TestDashboardBasicOps.test_basic_scenario fails sometimes and some
  time passes after multiple rechecks. In order to unblock the CI,
  we are adding it to skip list.

Change-Id: I3a5bc220fe1993fa1f72a67f974dba77f3ec7584

commit_message:
Use NetworkRBAC OVO in neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py

Migrate to use NetworkRBAC OVO in NeutronDBPluginV2.

Partially-Implements: blueprint adopt-oslo-versioned-objects-for-db
Change-Id: I202318b4a4b91d03177d5e9792565e9daa44f9fb

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I825550ecc5a3a15b981a177300d152f23a6541e9
Closes-Bug:  #1801467

commit_message:
Verify port_forwarding subnet and IP address both

Free subnet can not remove from router if other router's
subnets have port_forwarding. This patch fixed it by
checking the router interface subnet and IP address.

Co-Authored-By: LIU Yulong <i@liuyulong.me>
Closes-Bug: #1799140
Change-Id: Idace35126bb00139fa1f9f48be3aa3aab265b9d8
(cherry picked from commit f5d3a4159bcd526384ab2063ad9082f1a0d291b1)

subject: Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-03 17:22:54.000000000', 'message': "Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ib6f00e56bf80f5f0ba1fde4b29d94b68dda6462e
"}]
commit_message:
Don't quote {posargs} in tox.ini

Quotes around {posargs} cause the entire string to be combined into one
arg that gets passed to stestr. This prevents passing multiple args
(e.g. '--concurrency=16 some-regex')

Change-Id: Ib6f00e56bf80f5f0ba1fde4b29d94b68dda6462e

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 09:07:23.000000000', 'message': "Don't uninstall flow tables in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br

This is a revise for I7b24a159962af7b58c096a1b2766e2169e9f8aed

Br-int's flow tables are already uninstalled in setup_integration_br.
And setup_integration_br will install some default flows. If we still
uninstall flow tables of br-int in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br, these
default flow tables will be missing.

Closes-Bug: #1775146
Change-Id: I71c1f9034dfc913b9e9ae17cc8f6bd084c9ee580
(cherry picked from commit 760870b6c238f5f2aa5fec33852e51b4ebccb718)
"}, {'created': '2018-10-31 15:44:50.000000000', 'message': "Don't uninstall flow tables in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br

This is a revise for I7b24a159962af7b58c096a1b2766e2169e9f8aed

Br-int's flow tables are already uninstalled in setup_integration_br.
And setup_integration_br will install some default flows. If we still
uninstall flow tables of br-int in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br, these
default flow tables will be missing.

Closes-Bug: #1775146
Change-Id: I71c1f9034dfc913b9e9ae17cc8f6bd084c9ee580
(cherry picked from commit 760870b6c238f5f2aa5fec33852e51b4ebccb718)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't uninstall flow tables in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br

This is a revise for I7b24a159962af7b58c096a1b2766e2169e9f8aed

Br-int's flow tables are already uninstalled in setup_integration_br.
And setup_integration_br will install some default flows. If we still
uninstall flow tables of br-int in setup_dvr_flows_on_integ_br, these
default flow tables will be missing.

Closes-Bug: #1775146
Change-Id: I71c1f9034dfc913b9e9ae17cc8f6bd084c9ee580
(cherry picked from commit 760870b6c238f5f2aa5fec33852e51b4ebccb718)

commit_message:
WIP: Add priorityClassName

This patch set adds in a helm-toolkit function to support priority className.
See [0].  This feature is listed in alpha as K8s 1.8 and beta as K8s 1.11.

[0] https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/pod-priority-preemption/

Change-Id: I36792e6b02ea0b3fed5e6fa0fc654189ba5bc2a6
Signed-off-by: Tin Lam <tin@irrational.io>

commit_message:
Passing thread pool size to IPA for parallel erasure

Adds a configuration option [deploy]disk_erasure_concurrency
to define the size of thread pool, and pass it to IPA. The value
defines the maximum number of threads can be utilized for
parallel disk erasure at IPA side.

Change-Id: Ie7fe8ac730e7ee161443b39a8c0fe79b2848fc87
Story: 1546949
Task: 26973

commit_message:
Changed the port numbers

Before keystone needed to be run on two separate ports to
accommodate the Identity v2 API which ran a separate
admin-only service commonly on port 35357. With the removal
of the v2 API, keystone runs only on port 5000.

Change-Id: I012662ea2af80441c99bafee757569d8b0d40ff3

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-17 14:08:06.000000000', 'message': "Fix NoneType error in _notify_volume_usage_detach

If the driver.block_stats() method returns None, like the
libvirt driver will if the guest is gone during an evacuate,
we'll get a NoneType error trying to unpack the return value
from the driver. Instead, simply return as if the driver
raised NotImplementedError.

Since handling None is changing the contract on the virt
driver API, the docstring is updated to explain the acceptable
return values of the driver method.

Change-Id: I98a2785c07f7af02ad83650c72d9e1868290ece4
Closes-Bug: #1796981
(cherry picked from commit 4da54c07861a1542a8e30a768d4506d3e81b5598)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix NoneType error in _notify_volume_usage_detach

If the driver.block_stats() method returns None, like the
libvirt driver will if the guest is gone during an evacuate,
we'll get a NoneType error trying to unpack the return value
from the driver. Instead, simply return as if the driver
raised NotImplementedError.

Since handling None is changing the contract on the virt
driver API, the docstring is updated to explain the acceptable
return values of the driver method.

Change-Id: I98a2785c07f7af02ad83650c72d9e1868290ece4
Closes-Bug: #1796981
(cherry picked from commit 4da54c07861a1542a8e30a768d4506d3e81b5598)

commit_message:
Remove python3 release jobs

Remove release-openstack-python3 and test-release-openstack-python3 - we
use the normal versions now.

Update instack repos to follow this stack of changes, it used the jobs from
publis-to-pypi-python3 directly.

Change-Id: Iaf91ebbd3ff9208a4ef3d7a06dc6207a6e9fb973
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615241

We had a workaround in the adapter for places where we were mocking
internals of things. We're not longer doing that and are instead

commit_message:
Remove mocking workaround from adapter

We had a workaround in the adapter for places where we were mocking
internals of things. We're not longer doing that and are instead
appropriately using requests-mock, so we no longer need the workaround.

Change-Id: I4c9b6e784752f9ca2d1009553003913bad1761d0

Ensure pip/setuptools/wheel are up to date in the wheel build venv

build has an up to date and the right versions of pip/setuptools/wheel.

[{'created': '2018-10-10 14:54:08.000000000', 'message': 'Sets ODL OVSDB inactivity probe timer

Defaults the ODL OVSDB inactivity probe timer to 180s. This value is
more suitable for large number of compute nodes as the default ODL value
of 5s causes too much stress on the controller in large scale
environments.

Closes-Bug: 1797128

Change-Id: I74a8c40b609adec97a27602700bbfa7203ad031f
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-24 15:43:40.000000000', 'message': 'Sets ODL OVSDB inactivity probe timer

Defaults the ODL OVSDB inactivity probe timer to 180s. This value is
more suitable for large number of compute nodes as the default ODL value
of 5s causes too much stress on the controller in large scale
environments.

Closes-Bug: 1797128

Change-Id: I74a8c40b609adec97a27602700bbfa7203ad031f
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Sets ODL OVSDB inactivity probe timer

Defaults the ODL OVSDB inactivity probe timer to 180s. This value is
more suitable for large number of compute nodes as the default ODL value
of 5s causes too much stress on the controller in large scale
environments.

Closes-Bug: 1797128

Change-Id: I74a8c40b609adec97a27602700bbfa7203ad031f
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

subject: Added alembic environment
messages:
[{'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:02:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-17 21:41:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

If I wanted to play with this, what do I do?'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-18 15:29:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

As far as playing with it goes, I want to add a test that will give you (and others) a sample of how alembic migrations should work and be tested. This is all very rough at the moment.'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-22 16:32:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-22 19:06:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-22 19:08:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

One big issue with this right now is that the b4ed3a175331_initial.py version doesn't have an entry for creation the Allocations table, so even once env.py is updated to have the right info, plenty of tests fail.

However, some are able to pass. For example, I was able to get resource-class-related gabbits to pass.

Passing the ball back to Ed now."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-22 21:57:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-23 18:21:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-23 19:17:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)

Is the get_engine within really required?

Did you figure out what was causing the missing allocations table?'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-23 19:39:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-24 17:43:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-24 17:49:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Cool. For your next trick can you do a follow up WIP which shows a migration adding a column to a table and perhaps changing the type of another table? Which might present the ideal time for placement-specific docs for "how to add a migration".

(you try to do a good deed, ed, and now you have all the work)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-25 19:33:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-29 11:09:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

Thanks, this looks good and doesn't seem to be breaking things, but we're going to need at least one more bit, probably in followups:

* docs (short, to the point, pointing to alembic docs is fine) on how to add a migration

My inclination would be that we get this moving forward, fix up I1ff472106610150a587f5286f26a6bd7c1aa84f4 to a real command line, and get ourselves going as much as possible. Having this stuff working is our main blocker for moving forward with working devstack, working integration tests and being able to add new features."}, {'account_id': 9708, 'date': '2018-10-29 13:39:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Code-Review+1

(1 comment)

I don't see anything obviously wrong with this but I don't have too much alembic experience."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-29 15:03:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-29 20:44:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 7.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-29 21:10:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 7:

(1 comment)

For the offline stuff, this looks good, but I've discovered some issues with online, see my comment within and a coming follow up to demo."}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-30 20:51:18.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 8.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-30 21:26:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-31 13:16:44.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 9.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:07:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:08:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

We should probably put https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/tools/test-setup.sh in the placement repo before this in the series so the mysql/postgresql tests are run.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:11:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:20:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 9:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:20:26.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:22:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 1063, 'date': '2018-10-31 14:38:19.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 11.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-31 15:06:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: Code-Review-1

Alembic is coming in to this as a transitive requirement for oslo_db, we should probably make it a bit explicit in placement's requirements.txt.

I've got a patch coming further in the stack to remove sqlalchemy-migrate."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-10-31 15:15:29.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

'}, {'created': '2018-10-22 16:32:13.000000000', 'message': 'Added alembic environment

Added alembic, and created an initial database revision.

Change-Id: I7ea9dbe6a72a40c926d74cc344268181e35a65b3
'}, {'created': '2018-10-22 19:06:50.000000000', 'message': 'Added alembic environment

Added alembic, and created an initial database revision.

Note: the env.py file is expected to be customized for whatever
local requirements may be present. Our local requirement is
that the engine and connection information comes from other

commit_message:
standalone/undercloud: run post_upgrade_tasks when upgrading

This changes the upgrade workflow for the standalone and undercloud
where we now run the post_upgrade_tasks after the deployment.
So the order is upgrade_tasks, deployment steps (docker/puppet),
then post_upgrade_tasks which is the same order as the overcloud.
It will allow us to execute some specific post upgrade tasks on standalone
and undercloud, like removing Docker containers when upgrading to Podman.

Change-Id: I311bfa17a3bbe52850092d501d563d53f7095a24

commit_message:
Re-enable manila tests in scenario004/pike

The bugfix to manila's tempest tests
has merged [1]. Only enable them in pike,
until test issues have been fixed in ocata.
(Newton's EOL upstream).

Also cleanup the manila API version switches
for readability, and tag the appropriate version
of the manila test package in featureset008.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/603171/

Closes-Bug: #1790857
Change-Id: Ia0418fa210f13392643c3b960a8baeec7c168304

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 03:47:47.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multiattach set to false after retype

The return value of get_by_name_or_id in the volume_types module
returns a dictionary.
During the function call to _is_multiattach, the getattr() returns
{}(default value) because a dictionary is passed instead of an object.
After importing the cinder.objects.volume_type module,
the current function call to get_by_name_or_id() returns an object
hence getattr() will return the appropriate extra_specs instead of
the default value({}).

Closes-Bug: 1790840
Change-Id: I869bc0c9b18887da1ea83f855d255557f0f3cba0
(cherry picked from commit 7f85be418669286392c833479dfdc7c2a33f86d1)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix multiattach set to false after retype

The return value of get_by_name_or_id in the volume_types module
returns a dictionary.
During the function call to _is_multiattach, the getattr() returns
{}(default value) because a dictionary is passed instead of an object.
After importing the cinder.objects.volume_type module,
the current function call to get_by_name_or_id() returns an object
hence getattr() will return the appropriate extra_specs instead of
the default value({}).

Closes-Bug: 1790840
Change-Id: I869bc0c9b18887da1ea83f855d255557f0f3cba0
(cherry picked from commit 7f85be418669286392c833479dfdc7c2a33f86d1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-04 11:49:42.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Refactor scatter-gather utility to return exception objects

Scatter-gather utility returns a raised_exception_sentinel for
all kinds of exceptions that are caught and often times there
maybe situations where we may have to handle the different types
of exceptions differently. To facilitate that, it might be more
useful to return the Exception object itself instead of the dummy
raised_exception_sentinel so that based on the result's exception
type we can handle them differently.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: I861b223ee46b0f0a31f646a4b45f8a02410253cf
"}, {'created': '2018-10-04 13:43:18.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Refactor scatter-gather utility to return exception objects

Scatter-gather utility returns a raised_exception_sentinel for
all kinds of exceptions that are caught and often times there
maybe situations where we may have to handle the different types
of exceptions differently. To facilitate that, it might be more
useful to return the Exception object itself instead of the dummy
raised_exception_sentinel so that based on the result's exception
type we can handle them differently.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: I861b223ee46b0f0a31f646a4b45f8a02410253cf
"}, {'created': '2018-10-05 12:01:34.000000000', 'message': "[WIP] Refactor scatter-gather utility to return exception objects

Scatter-gather utility returns a raised_exception_sentinel for
all kinds of exceptions that are caught and often times there
maybe situations where we may have to handle the different types
of exceptions differently. To facilitate that, it might be more
useful to return the Exception object itself instead of the dummy
raised_exception_sentinel so that based on the result's exception
type we can handle them differently.

commit_message:
Refactor scatter-gather utility to return exception objects

Scatter-gather utility returns a raised_exception_sentinel for
all kinds of exceptions that are caught and often times there
maybe situations where we may have to handle the different types
of exceptions differently. To facilitate that, it might be more
useful to return the Exception object itself instead of the dummy
raised_exception_sentinel so that based on the result's exception
type we can handle them differently.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: I861b223ee46b0f0a31f646a4b45f8a02410253cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-12 16:11:01.000000000', 'message': 'Fix audit target service selection

The keystonemiddleware audit code would select the wrong OpenStack service
endpoint for a request if the cloud is not using unique TCP ports for each
service endpoint. As most services are no longer using a port per service,
but instead using unique paths, this caused the audit to select the wrong
target service. This leads to incorrect audit logging due to the wrong
audit map being used.

This patch checks the request to see if a TCP port was present in the request,
and if not, fall back to using the target_endpoint_type configured in the
audit map file.

Change-Id: Ie2e0bf74ecca485d599a4041bb770bd6e296bc99
Closes-bug: 1797584

commit_message:
Fix audit target service selection

The keystonemiddleware audit code would select the wrong OpenStack service
endpoint for a request if the cloud is not using unique TCP ports for each
service endpoint. As most services are no longer using a port per service,
but instead using unique paths, this caused the audit to select the wrong
target service. This leads to incorrect audit logging due to the wrong
audit map being used.

This patch checks the request to see if a TCP port was present in the request,
and if not, fall back to using the target_endpoint_type configured in the
audit map file.

Change-Id: Ie2e0bf74ecca485d599a4041bb770bd6e296bc99
Closes-bug: 1797584

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Ie2263d924e9e4564a8d5c2c8e16499326ac08fdd

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-02 04:04:53.000000000', 'message': "Move metadata file creation for netapp to puppet-tripelo from THT

Since, openstack-glance package has been removed from overcloud image
during the cleanup, 'filesystem_store_metadata_file' file is failing to
create on host in case of glance netapp.

So, moving metadata file creation part in puppet-tripleo and setting
few more conf parameters which were missing previously. Also
merging the regular NFS and Netapp NFS mounts as the process of
mounting NFS share is independent of whether the share is for Netapp
server or any other nfs server.

Depends-on: I031a8921a74af137927ba83ee2307aafc13263cb
Change-Id: I621208c2d41a1942b48d4cf92fc1aa7f4e08e1d4

commit_message:
Move metadata file creation for netapp to puppet-tripelo from THT

Since, openstack-glance package has been removed from overcloud image
during the cleanup, 'filesystem_store_metadata_file' file is failing to
create on host in case of glance netapp.

So, moving metadata file creation part in puppet-tripleo and setting
few more conf parameters which were missing previously. Also
merging the regular NFS and Netapp NFS mounts as the process of
mounting NFS share is independent of whether the share is for Netapp
server or any other nfs server.

Depends-on: I031a8921a74af137927ba83ee2307aafc13263cb
Depends-on: If3a0bc37fe23698b5b5730b4e535f4f56b266a75
Change-Id: I621208c2d41a1942b48d4cf92fc1aa7f4e08e1d4

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-16 23:20:09.000000000', 'message': 'py3: Add direct_client

Not all of this may be entirely obvious. The problem with '%s' is
that it makes paths like "/b'0'/b'abc'". It's the same reason why
we prohibit str(): no exception is raised, just bogus corrupted
data leaking all over.

The old noop_timeout() trick was straight from the book before, but
on py3 it triggers this:
  TypeError: catching classes that do not inherit from BaseException
  is not allowed
It's going to happen in any code that does try .. except Timeout.
Therefore, a class.

The FileLikeIter() served us well, including on py3, right until
he time a test tried to stuff a b'astring' in there. Then:
  TypeError: object of type 'int' has no len()
Seemed easier to fix the common code and do the KISS thing than
to hunt down all the samples and make them lists or whatever.

This patch requires fixes to bufferedhttp.c, which we already have
under review, see Ic08c26185d63a36a5422793d81f621e0698fa572.

Change-Id: I355277f7fe8854c7e94915fde835a1b51f66fbef

Change-Id: I355277f7fe8854c7e94915fde835a1b51f66fbef
'}, {'created': '2018-08-25 03:59:09.000000000', 'message': 'DNM py3: Adapt direct_client and internal_client

Not all of this may be entirely obvious. The biggest change is
in the way swob represents the Request.environ. Before, the
terrible latin-1 representation was preserved where WSGI
provided it to us. Now, we discard it as soon as possible
and convert everything into a common type. This way, the
bulk of the code does not need to sprinkle tests for six.PY3
everywhere.

The new code is much better this way, but actually we only
did it because it was absolutely impossible to make Request.blank()
work when direct_client used it.

The internal_client didn't need much, just a bunch of fix-ups.

just bogus corrupted data leaking all over.

  is not allowed

he time a test tried to stuff a b'astring' in there. Then:
  TypeError: object of type 'int' has no len()
Seemed easier to fix the common code and do the KISS thing than

under review, see Ic08c26185d63a36a5422793d81f621e0698fa572.

implemented. This way the existing code does not need to be
concerned with weirdness of WSGI encoding, as long as they

commit_message:
py3: Adapt direct_client and internal_client

Not all of this may be entirely obvious. The swob was notionally
converted to py3 before, and this patch changes how that is
implemented. This way the existing code does not need to be
concerned with weirdness of WSGI encoding, as long as they
do not access .environ[] directly. Look at the req.path()
for a good example.

The query parameters aren't as fortunate. Before, they were
the native string, which sadly leaked the whole latin-1 debacle.
Now, they are uft-8 and thus platform independent. This is great
except for the code that used the old latin-1 as if it were
ASCII. Check the /info controller to see what the unfortunate
victim has to do. Sadly, we have really important parts that
assume utf-8 query parameters when container listings are
controlled with markers and delimiters.

The internal_client didn't need much, just a bunch of fix-ups.
The problem with '%s' is that it makes paths like "/b'0'/b'abc'".
It's the same reason why we prohibit str(): no exception is raised,
just bogus corrupted data leaking all over.

The old noop_timeout() trick was straight from the book before, but
on py3 it triggers this:
  TypeError: catching classes that do not inherit from BaseException
  is not allowed
It's going to happen in any code that does try .. except Timeout.
Therefore, a class.

The FileLikeIter() served us well, including on py3, right until
the time a test tried to stuff a b'astring' in there. Then:
  TypeError: object of type 'int' has no len()
Seemed easier to fix the common code and do the KISS thing than
to hunt down all the samples and make them lists or whatever.

Change-Id: I355277f7fe8854c7e94915fde835a1b51f66fbef

commit_message:
py3: Monkey-patch json.loads to accept bytes on py35

I'm tired of creating code churn where I just slap

    .decode("nearly arbitrary choice of encoding")

in a bunch of places.

Change-Id: I79b2bc59fed130ca537e96c1074212861d7db6b8

commit_message:
Fix usage of multiple accounts in functional tests

Some tests make use of multiple accounts without checking of they have
been set up. This commit tries to fix some of these situations.

Change-Id: I461679e78e19ce0866c7618c581a8cb573cca7f5

[{'created': '2018-11-02 15:05:06.000000000', 'message': 'Fix creating subnet without gateway

If create_subnet() method is called with gateway=None explicity,
subnet should be created without gateway_ip specified.
To achieve that "gateway_ip=null" should be passed in json in
request's body to neutron server.
This was missing, so neutron-server allocated gateway_ip automatically.

Change-Id: Ia9f0646a3cf371f82f2aa2dc22837249531d1ff5

commit_message:
Fix creating subnet without gateway

If create_subnet() method is called with gateway=None explicity,
subnet should be created without gateway_ip specified.
To achieve that "gateway_ip=null" should be passed in json in
request's body to neutron server.
This was missing, so neutron-server allocated gateway_ip automatically.
Now gateway for such network will not be set as is expected.

Closes-Bug: #1769609

Change-Id: Ia9f0646a3cf371f82f2aa2dc22837249531d1ff5

commit_message:
Disable port number 0 for floating IP port_forwarding

Floating IP port forwarding internal or external port number should
not allow 0, otherwise you will get some ValueError exception in
neutron server.

Directly modify the floating-ip-port-forwarding extension to change
the external_port and internal_port minimum value.

Change-Id: Icb177932f6cf1262757b29cb9b997321704616b7
Closes-Bug: #1799150

commit_message:
Add permanent ARP entries for DVR fip/qrouter veth pair

Since we know the IP and MAC addresses of both sides of the
fip/qrouter namespace veth pair device, just add permanent
ARP entries for them.

Change-Id: I6193b00681dfb79222eedfd00c89620321ac1b4f
Related-Bug: #1791989
(cherry picked from commit ac5815a110f0033c1a217481822fc0c72c1ba16c)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-13 22:49:03.000000000', 'message': 'Add multi-region support for Magnum

Magnum currently tries to hit the first region that it finds
so it can fail to deploy clusters in multi-region deployments
non-determinsitically.

This patch makes sure that the region can be configured and
it defaults to the same one that Magnum is deployed on.

Change-Id: I136ba0caead3a5afe11152aaed7bae94af8906b4
(cherry picked from commit fbdcdbd19cc2b1b914adbca82a8b152f32189851)
(cherry picked from commit 604d633d16652d2fe291d2a116ebbc95ec17bd91)
'}, {'created': '2018-10-25 11:55:45.000000000', 'message': 'Add multi-region support for Magnum

Magnum currently tries to hit the first region that it finds
so it can fail to deploy clusters in multi-region deployments
non-determinsitically.

This patch makes sure that the region can be configured and
it defaults to the same one that Magnum is deployed on.

Change-Id: I136ba0caead3a5afe11152aaed7bae94af8906b4
(cherry picked from commit fbdcdbd19cc2b1b914adbca82a8b152f32189851)
'}]
commit_message:
Add multi-region support for Magnum

Magnum currently tries to hit the first region that it finds
so it can fail to deploy clusters in multi-region deployments
non-determinsitically.

This patch makes sure that the region can be configured and
it defaults to the same one that Magnum is deployed on.

Change-Id: I136ba0caead3a5afe11152aaed7bae94af8906b4
(cherry picked from commit fbdcdbd19cc2b1b914adbca82a8b152f32189851)

commit_message:
Enable the mgr balancer module by default.

The balancer module will distribute PGs more evenly across OSDs. 
While CRUSH does a good job at this, it is not perfect and hot spots
(where an OSD has more PGs then it's peers) can occur.

Change-Id: Ic45a6bf745bdd09a3f5782e9e8bda89c3d3da2aa

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.3.2

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.3.2.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I0051938d70bdb3060981e8ce1cd2a72ca8d292ff

commit_message:
Switch back to publish-to-pypi

We updated publish-to-pypi so that it has the same content as
publish-to-pypi-python3 - and then replaced publish-to-pypi-python3 with
publish-to-pypi. Thus, publish-to-pypi does what publish-to-pypi-python3
has done previously.

Since all repos have been updated to use publish-to-pypi, check for that
one again.

Change-Id: I09ed2370a4d1f1bfb94cf73a951d0f1f6af36be6
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615239

commit_message:
Deprecate several iscsi_XXX parameters

Cinder removed support for several previously deprecated parameter
names [1], and this patch switches to using the actual name.

Deprecated Name   Parameter Name
----------------  -----------------
iscsi_ip_address  target_ip_address
iscsi_port        target_port
iscsi_helper      target_helper
iscsi_protocol    target_protocol

[1] https://review.openstack.org/595318

Partial-Bug: #1801081
Change-Id: I355298aaa7e48d242ad05b8c931ee9d41339185f

messages: [{'account_id': 24245, 'date': '2018-11-02 10:39:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:53:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 10:39:28.000000000', 'message': 'Fix Undercloud masquerading firewall rules

Iterate over destination for each source to have the
correct return rules created. (Passing a list as
destination to tripleo::firewall::rule does not work.)

Also the "forward destinations" rules should use the
source addresses in the data for both source and
destination rules.

Change-Id: I3d572bf4aab65f5befb596f7c90c94fc0abe7afa
Closes-Bug: #1797455
(cherry picked from commit bebe7b8c5892500db7cd30c2b4d259ae1f83cffc)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix Undercloud masquerading firewall rules

Iterate over destination for each source to have the
correct return rules created. (Passing a list as
destination to tripleo::firewall::rule does not work.)

Also the "forward destinations" rules should use the
source addresses in the data for both source and
destination rules.

Change-Id: I3d572bf4aab65f5befb596f7c90c94fc0abe7afa
Closes-Bug: #1797455
(cherry picked from commit bebe7b8c5892500db7cd30c2b4d259ae1f83cffc)

[{'created': '2018-11-02 10:06:32.000000000', 'message': "Create default deployment plan

Currently no default plan is created during a container-based undercloud
deployment.

This patch creates a default deployment plan if both of two conditions
apply:
- The /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates directory exists
  (We need the templates to create the plan)
- There is no container named `overcloud` in swift yet
  (If a deployment is run more than once we don't want to recreate
  the default plan)

Closes-Bug: #1798590

Change-Id: Id03631432b1fedd75ee3ddba67bfe7d5d6049a07
(cherry picked from commit 44b1f514191c949f3534463441b50932e2a89709)
"}]
commit_message:
Create default deployment plan

Currently no default plan is created during a container-based undercloud
deployment.

This patch creates a default deployment plan if both of two conditions
apply:
- The /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates directory exists
  (We need the templates to create the plan)
- There is no container named `overcloud` in swift yet
  (If a deployment is run more than once we don't want to recreate
  the default plan)

Closes-Bug: #1798590

Change-Id: Id03631432b1fedd75ee3ddba67bfe7d5d6049a07
(cherry picked from commit 44b1f514191c949f3534463441b50932e2a89709)

commit_message:
Properly remove libvirt default network

As well as destroying the network we should also undefine it
to ensure it does not return.

Change-Id: I57738856adb25c190357b1b23dd8a1245798cb14
Closes-Bug: #1800160

Or should we start using any2array from stdlib in module and keep os_any2array function but deprecate it? This is functionality which we never intended to expose to end users.'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-02 13:58:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-02 17:59:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 14985, 'date': '2018-11-02 18:53:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 14:47:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove os_any2array function

This function was implemented instead of using the
any2array function that stdlib exposes because before
people were using older versions of stdlib.

This function has now been available since stdlib 4.0.0
which is ealier 2013, we should now assume that people
have a sufficient version of stdlib and can remove the
custom os_any2array function we were carrying.

Change-Id: Ia1df93e480ec3137c138ee87d39f5d0ce432722c
'}]
commit_message:
Remove os_any2array function

This function was implemented instead of using the
any2array function that stdlib exposes because before
people were using older versions of stdlib.

This function has now been available since stdlib 4.0.0
which is ealier 2013, we should now assume that people
have a sufficient version of stdlib and can remove the
custom os_any2array function we were carrying.

Change-Id: Ia1df93e480ec3137c138ee87d39f5d0ce432722c

commit_message:
Sync publish-to-pypi templates

The publish-to-pypi-python3 template should work for all repos, there's
no need to have two versions. Sync the jobs and declare publish-to-pypi
as normal one and publish-to-pypi-python3 as obsolete.

Change-Id: I120c8ca4eb9492cf34ccbb51cfb5b219e7036419
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/615236
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/615239

commit_message:
Use python3 for release

Update the release-openstack-python job to use python3, it thus will
be the same as release-openstack-python3 which we can remove in a
followup change.

There's no need to have two variants, we can safely use the python3
variant everywhere.

Add also a test-release-openstack job as duplicate of
test-release-openstack-python3.

The goal of this whole patch series for project-config and
openstack-zuul-jobs is to give publish-to-pypi exactly the same set up
as publish-to-pypi-python3 has - and then use the updated
publish-to-pypi template everywhere so that we can remove
publish-to-pypi-python3.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/615237
Change-Id: I09cf4e64194395417c1bfa95237b04bd316c18fa

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 6928, 'name': 'Ben Nemec', 'email': 'openstack@nemebean.com', 'username': 'bnemec'}, {'_account_id': 11564, 'name': 'Chris Dent', 'email': 'cdent@anticdent.org', 'username': 'chdent'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 27954, 'name': 'Moisés Guimarães de Medeiros', 'email': 'guimaraes@pm.me', 'username': 'moguimar'}]

[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-25 19:07:11.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-25 19:08:14.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

As the commit message indicates, just after some initial feedback at this point.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-07-27 17:30:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Overall this looks reasonable to me.  One suggestion inline about how to inject the new driver after the cli but before files.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-07-27 19:41:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)

Good suggestion, thank you.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:36:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-06 14:41:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

This is still a work in progress, but posting up again to show there's been some progress on the "check env 2nd" issue.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-08-07 11:31:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(5 comments)

Hi Chris,

Nice WIP, I have some comments below.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-07 12:03:40.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

(6 comments)

Thanks for the feedback, some responses within. We'll likely need some additional discussion on how to manage it being present by default."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-07 12:47:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-07 12:49:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

I started looking into adding the env variable to the config generator output and realized a few things:

* I don't really know how to we would prefer to format that.
* I'm not sure it is a great idea: seems like a lot of noise that might be better explained by a single overriding rule which describes how the env names are generated.

Thoughts?"}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-08-08 16:02:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-08-09 09:58:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-08-23 11:44:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Thanks for the review, sorry for taking so long to respond. It's been a busy time.

My understanding during the spec review was that request with "Update the sample configuration generator..." was to make it so that the generated sample configs (and docs) would include the variable name associated with the each option shown in the generated in the output. If that's not the case, then yes this gets a lot easier.

What do you think? If we do want that I'm unclear on how that's done.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-08-23 11:59:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

> Thanks for the review, sorry for taking so long to respond. It's
 > been a busy time.
 > 
 > My understanding during the spec review was that request with
 > "Update the sample configuration generator..." was to make it so
 > that the generated sample configs (and docs) would include the
 > variable name associated with the each option shown in the
 > generated in the output. If that's not the case, then yes this gets
 > a lot easier.
 > 
 > What do you think? If we do want that I'm unclear on how that's
 > done.

I think I suggested doing that. I didn't put any thought into implementation, and it can probably wait.

Someone (Chris?) expressed concern that it would clutter up the generated file. Maybe we want a flag to turn it on/off? Maybe we want a generator mode that just dumps variable names and descriptions instead of adding them to the existing INI file output? Let's give that some thought and not hold up this patch over it.

I will come back and do a more thorough review of this patch next week when I have more time, if others on the team don't beat me to it.'}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-08-23 12:43:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

IMHO, if the environment driver is enabled by default and declaring an environment driver in the config file is not functional, then the option should not appear in the config sample. The driver just have to be explained in the docs.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-08-24 22:12:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

One concern about exception handling inline.

Besides that, I'm fine with just documenting the variable name scheme and not explicitly including the name for every opt in the sample config.  If we can find a clean way to integrate it then we can do that, but I wouldn't block this over it."}, {'account_id': 27954, 'date': '2018-09-04 12:25:30.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Also, when calling the conf object, we have the opportunity to skip the args with:

conf(args=[])

or even parse an specific file only with:

conf(args=[], default_config_files=['xyz.conf'])

We should have an option to turn off env as well, something like:

conf(env=False)

conf(args=[], env=False, default_config_files=['xyz.conf'])"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-03 12:44:48.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-03 12:47:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Sorry it has taken me so long to get back to this. Placement/PTG/etc ate me up for a while. I will be gone next week as well, so if someone would like to pick up any last cleanups on this, please feel free.

I think this is much closer to complete now, based on the earlier feedback, but still probably needs a few tweaks:

* The exception handling has been tweaked quite a bit to try to address both of Ben's concerns in one go but it may need more attention from people more familiar with the code.
* I tried to bring the docs to something useful, but I suspect I missed something."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-04 09:00:07.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-16 15:04:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)

Overall lgtm. One concern inline about the discoverability of these new docs. We also need a release note for this.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:50:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Workflow-1

(1 comment)

new version coming, with links and reno'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:50:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-17 19:56:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2

Thanks!'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-02 12:41:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-11-02 16:07:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

recheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-07-25 19:07:11.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add support for looking in environment for config

This is a quick spike of a ConfigurationSource that looks
in os.environ for values. The enviroment is inspected before
any other sources of config data. The names of the environment
variables follow the rules described in
oslo_config.sources._environment.

This is done in a rather hacky way, to see if I'm on the
right path and to get some initial feedback. Besides
validating the approach other things to do are:

* real tests
* update documentation
* include environment variable names when generating config
  samples and documentation

My main difficulty at this point is understanding the
abstractions enough to know if I'm hitting the right things.

In the spec we say:

    The source will be available by default, ideally coming
    second in the stack, after individual command line
    overrides, but before any files or other sources. If this
    proves impossible because of inter-dependencies in the
    file and command line handling, first in the stack is
    the second-best option.

It's not clear (at least not yet) how to make it second.

Change-Id: I3245c40ebdcc96f8e3b2dc0bab3b4aa71d07ad15
"}, {'created': '2018-08-06 15:58:41.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add support for looking in environment for config

This is a quick spike of a ConfigurationSource that looks
in os.environ for values. The enviroment is inspected before
any other sources of config data but the value is only used
after command line arguments but before config file options.

This is done by checking both the command line and config
files and then inspecting the location of the result. If
it command_line, we use it. If not, we use the environment
value (if any). If there's no environment value, the config
file value is used. If checking the command line and config
file results in a KeyError, the environment value is used,
if set.

The names of the environment variables follow the rules
described in oslo_config.sources._environment.

This is still a work in progress. Still required:

* update documentation
* include environment variable names when generating config
  samples and documentation

Change-Id: I3245c40ebdcc96f8e3b2dc0bab3b4aa71d07ad15
"}, {'created': '2018-08-07 12:47:36.000000000', 'message': "WIP: Add support for looking in environment for config

This is a quick spike of a ConfigurationSource that looks
in os.environ for values. The enviroment is inspected before
any other sources of config data but the value is only used
after command line arguments but before config file options.

This is done by checking both the command line and config
files and then inspecting the location of the result. If
it command_line, we use it. If not, we use the environment
value (if any). If there's no environment value, the config
file value is used. If checking the command line and config
file results in a KeyError, the environment value is used,
if set.

The names of the environment variables follow the rules
described in oslo_config.sources._environment.

This is still a work in progress. Still required:

* update documentation
* include environment variable names when generating config
  samples and documentation

Change-Id: I3245c40ebdcc96f8e3b2dc0bab3b4aa71d07ad15
"}, {'created': '2018-10-03 12:44:48.000000000', 'message': "Add support for looking in environment for config

An _environment source is added that looks in os.environ for
values.

Using the environment is on by default, but can be shut down
by setting `use_env` to False when __call__ is called.

The enviroment is inspected before any other sources
of config data but the value is used after command line
arguments and before config file options.

This is done by checking both the command line and config
files and then inspecting the location of the result. If
it is command_line, we use it. If not, we use the environment
value (if any). If there's no environment value, the config
file value is used. If checking the command line and config
file results in a KeyError, the environment value is used,
if set.

The names of the environment variables follow the rules
described in oslo_config.sources._environment.

A new exception has been added: ConfigSourceValueError, this
is the superclass of the existing ConfigFileValueError. The
code in _do_get has been updated to only use
ConfigFileValueError when it is in fact a file from whence a
ValueError came.

Documentation has been updated to indicate the new
functionality.

Change-Id: I3245c40ebdcc96f8e3b2dc0bab3b4aa71d07ad15
"}, {'created': '2018-10-04 09:00:07.000000000', 'message': "Add support for looking in environment for config

An _environment source is added that looks in os.environ for
values.

Using the environment is on by default, but can be shut down
by setting `use_env` to False when __call__ is called.

The enviroment is inspected before any other sources
of config data but the value is used after command line
arguments and before config file options.

This is done by checking both the command line and config
files and then inspecting the location of the result. If
it is command_line, we use it. If not, we use the environment

file results in a KeyError, the environment value is used,
if set.

The names of the environment variables follow the rules

A new exception has been added: ConfigSourceValueError, this
is the superclass of the existing ConfigFileValueError. The
code in _do_get has been updated to only use
ConfigFileValueError when it is in fact a file from whence a
ValueError came.

Documentation has been updated to indicate the new

commit_message:
Add support for looking in environment for config

An _environment source is added that looks in os.environ for
values.

Using the environment is on by default, but can be shut down
by setting `use_env` to False when __call__ is called.

The enviroment is inspected before any other sources
of config data but the value is used after command line
arguments and before config file options.

This is done by checking both the command line and config
files and then inspecting the location of the result. If
it is command_line, we use it. If not, we use the environment
value (if any). If there's no environment value, the config
file value is used. If checking the command line and config
file results in a KeyError, the environment value is used,
if set.

The names of the environment variables follow the rules
described in oslo_config.sources._environment.

A new exception has been added: ConfigSourceValueError, this
is the superclass of the existing ConfigFileValueError. The
code in _do_get has been updated to only use
ConfigFileValueError when it is in fact a file from whence a
ValueError came.

Documentation has been updated and a rlease note created to
indicate the new functionality.

Change-Id: I3245c40ebdcc96f8e3b2dc0bab3b4aa71d07ad15

commit_message:
Don't install python virtual/pip RPMs if present

The fedora28 nodesets from zuul excludes pip/virtualenv/setuptool at dnf.conf
to prevent from jobs to install them, if we try to install it the job
will fail.

This patch only install pip/virtualenv using RPMs if they are not
present in the system.

Change-Id: Iba3be366a05c417101b1e97f26b7330bfe6b1322
Story: https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/task/310?kanban-status=1447275

commit_message:
Creating volume prompt message always contain name

The creating volume successful prompt message format is:
  'Creating volume "%s"' % data["name"]
the data['name'] could be empty since it is not request.
But volume.name is always has a value, that the name or
id of volume.

Change-Id: Ife870ebbc1f37a44729637ddec283686d29234fb
Closes-Bug: #1800575

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I97f0eb421287a67964d4ada71c766113f334b89d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Nagios: Ensure processes are reaped

This moves Nagios to run as child processes of either
the pause container or use the hosts init system (for k8s <1.10)
to prevent defunct process sprawl

Change-Id: I6a93d446577674b0b012f9567d5e6a5794ebc44b

memoized now operates as a LRU cache that additionally uses
weakrefs to clear keys.

The max_size of the LRU cache can be set per decorated

'}]
commit_message:
rework memoized as a LRU cache with expiry

memoized now operates as a LRU cache that additionally uses
weakrefs to clear keys.

The max_size of the LRU cache can be set per decorated
function when defined, but a global default can be set too.

Change-Id: I431d61283cd613f09664f8f370dd3fd126fc724f

commit_message:
openvswitch: always run handler to to ensure OVS bridges are up

When editing external bridge configuration and running a reconfigure
on openvswitch, handler "Ensuring OVS bridge is properly setup"
needs to run, but doesn't.

This moves the task from handlers to own file and always includes it
after running the handlers.

Change-Id: Iee39cf00b743ab0776354749c6e162814b5584d8
Closes-Bug: #1794504
(cherry picked from commit 8736817a989213df0f40a72f7e7163d9792aee43)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I499030b8cc7747ef0169a69cef9927c5b50c1677
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I8a1fbe1cc6fd18856d729ffc49d6d4018edb8b09
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I0994780897c5f3f3d54ccc916f14651951aef8dc
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'created': '2018-10-25 20:58:26.000000000', 'message': "Default --nic to 'auto' if creating a server with >= 2.37

Compute API version >= 2.37 requires a 'networks' value in
the server create request. The novaclient CLI defaults this
to 'auto' if not specified, but the novaclient ServerManager.create
python API binding code does not, as it wants clients to be explicit.

commit_message:
Default --nic to 'auto' if creating a server with >= 2.37

Compute API version >= 2.37 requires a 'networks' value in
the server create request. The novaclient CLI defaults this
to 'auto' if not specified, but the novaclient ServerManager.create
python API binding code does not, as it wants clients to be explicit.

For the purposes of the OSC CLI, we should follow suit and if the
user is requesting OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION>=2.37 without specific
nics, we should just default to 'auto'.

Change-Id: Ib760c55e31209223338a4086ff1f4fee88dc6959
Closes-Bug: #1750395
(cherry picked from commit 1008544882fbdae16b045abca05cf3e2e8a14787)
(cherry picked from commit 4944d4eaa9aaeffdee358680550ac7d7f0c6e8d8)

commit_message:
Default --nic to 'auto' if creating a server with >= 2.37

Compute API version >= 2.37 requires a 'networks' value in
the server create request. The novaclient CLI defaults this
to 'auto' if not specified, but the novaclient ServerManager.create
python API binding code does not, as it wants clients to be explicit.

For the purposes of the OSC CLI, we should follow suit and if the
user is requesting OS_COMPUTE_API_VERSION>=2.37 without specific
nics, we should just default to 'auto'.

Change-Id: Ib760c55e31209223338a4086ff1f4fee88dc6959
Closes-Bug: #1750395
(cherry picked from commit 1008544882fbdae16b045abca05cf3e2e8a14787)

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I731b0717ad6aa9c0b9f4ce193300ded79671c7aa
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I95fd018830ada8123cd06519dec612a084055571
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Make use of keystoneauth service-type filtering for versions

The first version of the versions show command does client-side
service-type filtering, which while functional, causes many more API
calls than needed. Now that keystoneauth supports the filtering at the
source, use it.

Change-Id: I57c49e67f9cb285a5f5bc19ec53a42d10de9f0da

commit_message:
remove basepython from default testenv settings

We do not want to set basepython in [testenv] because that overrides
the value used in the automatic environments like py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If198a38def34c3017523ab2fa8fec1c094732443
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

I don't have a strong preference (I think we can make everything work and I don't want to spend too much time discussing meeting frequency).

That said, I'd say one month is too long, and every two week might hit the sweet spot between too often (and being back to people not doing TC work outside of meetings) and not often enough (losing our community)."}, {'account_id': 17068, 'date': '2018-10-10 13:32:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

> I don't have a strong preference (I think we can make everything
 > work and I don't want to spend too much time discussing meeting

 > 
 > That said, I'd say one month is too long, and every two week might
 > hit the sweet spot between too often (and being back to people not
 > doing TC work outside of meetings) and not often enough (losing our
 > community).

My opinion is exacly like Thierry's."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-10 18:26:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> > I don't have a strong preference (I think we can make everything
 > > work and I don't want to spend too much time discussing meeting
 > > frequency).
 > >
 > > That said, I'd say one month is too long, and every two week
 > might
 > > hit the sweet spot between too often (and being back to people
 > not
 > > doing TC work outside of meetings) and not often enough (losing
 > our
 > > community).
 > 
 > My opinion is exacly like Thierry's.

By my count I think that's 1 in favor of weekly; 2 in favor of biweekly; and 3 in favor of monthly.

There isn't clear consensus based on that limited sample.

I should point out that I do not plan to implement a "meet as needed" policy regardless of the frequency we pick (we will meet unless there is a holiday or other conflict), so keep that in mind as you're voting.'}, {'account_id': 5046, 'date': '2018-10-10 18:32:04.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1 -Code-Review

I'm in favor of at *least* meeting, which this change establishes. I would think we can adjust to biweekly or weekly if the volume of work appropriate for official meetings, as opposed to office hours, demands that change."}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-11 00:13:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

FWIW: I'd be okay with bi-weekly.  I will push up a change with the charter change mentioning biweekly and you can vote on your preferred one."}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-11 02:41:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

I am ok with monthly frequency as start and yes we can always reiterate if required. me too not fan of too many meetings(love office hour though where many people available casually for fixed amount of time for discussion.)'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-10-11 10:37:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

All things considered I think I prefer the 2-week variant that mnaser posted at https://review.openstack.org/#/c/609562/, so I +1ed that one instead.'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:11:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:13:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-15 12:01:34.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

(1 comment)

I'm okay with this, because I do feel like we need a bit of something to focus the TC's attention as a team who need to share some brain with each other.

However, as I note within, I think having a meeting is a clear indicator of us working as a group to the exclusion of others. We need to do that, but we also need to make sure that working with the rest of the community is just as important."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:46:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5263, 'date': '2018-10-29 18:52:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

[{'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-11 00:16:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 308, 'date': '2018-10-11 10:34:59.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1

All considered, I think I prefer this variant better. It checks more boxes in terms of outward-facing communications, and the cost is limited. I think we can try this for a while and readjust.'}, {'account_id': 1004, 'date': '2018-10-11 12:20:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2018-10-11 12:55:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

For the intent I see these meetings fulfilling, I do not think we need to hold them weekly. They should just be administrative bookkeeping for the TC, and all conversations and things of substance should be done at any point in the #openstack-tc channel or via the mailing list.'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-11 13:04:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote+1'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:13:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

i prefer the other one - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/608751/'}, {'account_id': 11655, 'date': '2018-10-11 16:15:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: -Rollcall-Vote

Thinking about it, I'd prefer for us to start at monthly, and if we really feel the need (or can measure, as in if the agenda surpasses the amount of time we have for a time boxed meeting), then we can pivot and adjust."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-15 11:52:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

too frequent'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2018-10-24 00:30:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Rollcall-Vote-1

I'm concerned that meetings with the wrong content will cause a perception - among both ourselves and the community - that they're replacing office hours. Holding meetings too often could exacerbate that. I think we should start with monthly and re-evaluate after we've tried it whether we either have too much (legitimate) business to fit the agenda or are on too slow a cadence."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-02 18:25:18.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

https://review.openstack.org/608751 was approved instead'}]

commit_message:
Allow endpoint filtering on both project and project-domain

The --project and --project-domain flags are currently mutually
exclusive for listing endpoints, however the --project-domain argument
is supposed to help with filtering projects with colliding names. They
should be allowed together.

Story: 2004018
Task: 27006
Change-Id: I7340e01f509e3515f07cb46f175fb603f1ce8b67
(cherry picked from commit 91a2d888625488da3f65ad372b4248e9747b9a3e)

commit_message:
Allow endpoint filtering on both project and project-domain

The --project and --project-domain flags are currently mutually
exclusive for listing endpoints, however the --project-domain argument
is supposed to help with filtering projects with colliding names. They
should be allowed together.

Story: 2004018
Task: 27004
Change-Id: I7340e01f509e3515f07cb46f175fb603f1ce8b67
(cherry picked from commit 91a2d888625488da3f65ad372b4248e9747b9a3e)

commit_message:
Add show_image_direct_url when glance_backend_ceph is true

When use ceph as the backend storage of glance, the
'show_image_direct_url' must be set to True when
would like to use copy-on-write in the ceph offical
documents

Change-Id: Ide644ebc1917b8f9931e48c77c7808ba62a36d7c

You probably want to create a local branch with the first commit (see [1]) then cherry-pick the second commit onto that branch. You can use the Cherry-pick command from the Download button for that or cherry-pick from a local copy of the commit if you have one. Then when you git review it will ask if you really wanted to submit two separate reviews (you did :-) and then the patches will be in a series on Gerrit.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-31 17:00:08.000000000', 'message': "Stop asserting on Eventlet internals

Eventlet has used at least three different clock implementations by
default over the past couple of years (time.time, vendored monotonic,
and plain monotonic). Since we're forcing use of monotonic anyway,
this is all irrelevant to us outside of the fact that once we depend
on a new enough version of eventlet we can remove our monkey patching
of the hub. Asserting on the particular module that eventlet uses by
default is just breaking our unit tests on newer eventlet for no
good reason.

Change-Id: I0f5135567a16dde4c34cee35baa2054091dce728
Partial-Bug: 1788959
(cherry picked from commit a850fda322649317786bb9f36eb8af05708f0210)
"}]
commit_message:
Stop asserting on Eventlet internals

Eventlet has used at least three different clock implementations by
default over the past couple of years (time.time, vendored monotonic,
and plain monotonic). Since we're forcing use of monotonic anyway,
this is all irrelevant to us outside of the fact that once we depend
on a new enough version of eventlet we can remove our monkey patching
of the hub. Asserting on the particular module that eventlet uses by
default is just breaking our unit tests on newer eventlet for no
good reason.

Change-Id: I0f5135567a16dde4c34cee35baa2054091dce728
Partial-Bug: 1788959
(cherry picked from commit a850fda322649317786bb9f36eb8af05708f0210)

commit_message:
Address issues from volume backend commands

This fixes some minor issues in release notes and the command list for
the new volume backend commands.

Also sorts the fakes used for volume unit tests to allow for multiple
command update patches to hopefully reduce the odds of merge conflicts.

Change-Id: Ic6e40f4c639368338cf085c68c17038f81da5361
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>
