commit_message:
Add scenario 012 - overlcoud baremetal+ansible-ml2

Used by a new featureset[1] that uses the neutron ansible-networking driver
to configure the switch providing networking for overcloud ironic
nodes such that tenant networks are segregated via vlan.

This scenario also sets up ssh keys so that ansible inside the neutron
container can ssh to the controller to configure OVS.

The new scenario also includes a temporary workaround to upgrade
ansible in the neutron container, this can be removed once ansible
in the container is v2.5.8+

Also remove scenario011 as the patches that used it never merged and
now the tennant networks are working in the overcloud, we'll test
with this instead.

[1] - https://review.openstack.org/#/c/579601/

Change-Id: Ife83825216ccb96a5f24918f42a757d0c48b0e9d

commit_message:
Allow standalone to manage selinux

In some cases we may need to disable selinux (like in CI). The role
needs the SELinux service so that the management can be done during the
deployment.

NOTE: this squashes the original patch with the bugfix patch
I4dde00e615be3a3c13fa8a21f8a5eb4ca9dbfbec

Change-Id: Ife3c4600f5bd70490a68059eb27c5100743a5298
Closes-Bug: #1797910
(cherry picked from commit 7451fc44de73ff4b609344fba3c2393746e9cdfb)
(cherry picked from commit 62418388b2ba896859829d6f8a2888cbcca05a46)

Adds support for a '--disable-discovery' argument to the 'kayobe
physical network configure' command. This can be used to configure the

commit_message:
Add --disable-discovery argument to physical network

Adds support for a '--disable-discovery' argument to the 'kayobe
physical network configure' command. This can be used to configure the
physical network after discovery of bare metal compute nodes is
complete, to return the network to a normal state. The interface
configuration to be applied is configured via
'switch_interface_config_disable_discovery'.

Essentially, this is the mirror of the '--enable-discovery' argument.

Change-Id: I40426a8fd22e51e8ea3350013a614dfbcf2afccf
Story: 2004048
Task: 27054

commit_message:
Save kolla-generated per-node configuration in CI logs

Currently we're saving the config generated by kayobe for kolla, but not
the config generated by kolla for the containers. This change fixes
that.

Change-Id: I5558a4fb8285a4e96f6918d133452d664b7bf0fa

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 15:20:11.000000000', 'message': 'Use --never-download instead of --no-download

OpenSUSE 42 has an older version of virtualenv which does
not support the --no-download option, so we switch to use
--never-download which is the older name for the same option
which still works with newer versions of virtualenv too.

Change-Id: Ibb1766df4895dbc32fcfd03b755135f2b19df880
'}]
commit_message:
Use --never-download instead of --no-download

OpenSUSE 42 has an older version of virtualenv which does
not support the --no-download option, so we switch to use
--never-download which is the older name for the same option
which still works with newer versions of virtualenv too.

Change-Id: Ibb1766df4895dbc32fcfd03b755135f2b19df880

commit_message:
Add os_placement role to OpenStack-Ansible

This patch adds a new blank git repository to OpenStack-Ansible
for deploying placement as it is going to be extracted from
nova repository.

Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615187/
Change-Id: Ib36bf8560c29c8d52473d2533e2c9c5f4320a45e

subject: Fix get instance IP after heat test
messages: [{'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-11-02 17:03:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20936, 'date': '2018-11-02 17:10:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 17:03:21.000000000', 'message': "Fix get instance IP after heat test

There's an error in the way the IP of the instance that gets created by
the heat template is read. Since we're now redirecting the output to a
file, we need tee to let ansible still read from the standard output.

Change-Id: I796295879fe1d5693fcd349052f6d83611028a21
"}]
commit_message:
Fix get instance IP after heat test

There's an error in the way the IP of the instance that gets created by
the heat template is read. Since we're now redirecting the output to a
file, we need tee to let ansible still read from the standard output.

Change-Id: I796295879fe1d5693fcd349052f6d83611028a21

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-28 15:07:49.000000000', 'message': 'Do not remove whitespace around "ansible_connection: local" block

The condition to look for "ansible_connection: local" had Jinja2
whitespace removal as per the minus sign (-) at the end and start
of a block which is incompatible with whitespace changes added
from the fix to LP #1798044. Remove the additional whitespace
control and rely on the spacing added directly in the template
for the cases where a local ansible_connection is used.

Change-Id: Ia114edafe6f1b37d6e6d47af146ab35adeb79efd
Closes-Bug: #1800148
'}, {'created': '2018-10-29 11:05:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add additional whitespace around "ansible_connection: local"

The jinja2 condition to look for "ansible_connection: local"
did not contain enough whitespace and resulted in an invalid
Ansible inventory. This patch adds the missing whitespace by
indenting the condition.

Change-Id: Ia114edafe6f1b37d6e6d47af146ab35adeb79efd
Closes-Bug: #1800148
'}, {'created': '2018-10-29 16:50:31.000000000', 'message': 'Add additional whitespace around "ansible_connection: local"

The jinja2 condition to look for "ansible_connection: local"
did not contain enough whitespace and resulted in an invalid
Ansible inventory. This patch adds the missing whitespace by
indenting the condition.

Change-Id: Ia114edafe6f1b37d6e6d47af146ab35adeb79efd
Closes-Bug: #1800148
'}, {'created': '2018-10-31 15:19:26.000000000', 'message': 'Add additional whitespace around "ansible_connection: local"

The jinja2 condition to look for "ansible_connection: local"
did not contain enough whitespace and resulted in an invalid
Ansible inventory. This patch adds the missing whitespace by
indenting the condition.

Change-Id: Ia114edafe6f1b37d6e6d47af146ab35adeb79efd
Closes-Bug: #1800148
'}]
commit_message:
Add additional whitespace around "ansible_connection: local"

The jinja2 condition to look for "ansible_connection: local"
did not contain enough whitespace and resulted in an invalid
Ansible inventory. This patch adds the missing whitespace by
indenting the condition.

Change-Id: Ia114edafe6f1b37d6e6d47af146ab35adeb79efd
Closes-Bug: #1800148

Set correct project name for designate-neutron integration

The puppet module defaults to 'services', but we actually call it
'service'.

commit_message:
Add /v2 suffix to Designate uris

Neutron integration requires the versioned endpoint.  The Keystone
catalog value still needs to be unversioned though or Tempest
explodes.

Change-Id: I705208e3ef8a9e2e86b82b721bc87a45b6f4e36d

subject: Document when sample_default is in use
messages: [{'account_id': 6928, 'date': '2018-10-02 19:34:16.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2018-10-08 09:51:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2018-11-02 13:24:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-02 19:34:16.000000000', 'message': 'Document when sample_default is in use

Because sample_default makes the generator silently ignore the
actual default value, it is possible for it to cause confusion for
users. This change adds a message to the generated opt help to let
them know that the documented default may not be the actual default.

commit_message:
Document when sample_default is in use

Because sample_default makes the generator silently ignore the
actual default value, it is possible for it to cause confusion for
users. This change adds a message to the generated opt help to let
them know that the documented default may not be the actual default.

Change-Id: Ib48d5dd1d18546b5464e9e096c47d1e3d67be57c
Closes-Bug: 1795729

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I68759b87fa4c7af04a95bb188d94f7ddc724ef7d
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4aec49a43c2dd43cc90f4a59cc85ce928190738a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iccd9cdb9d1e8f59935ed43fa26826cb6f6d3636b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Use openstackclient instead of neutronclient

The python-neutronclient is deprecated. We should use openstackclient
and openstacksdk for the equivalent functionality.

Change-Id: Iaf49d6b7942343104e0b40b6db89b78a793b858b

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0. Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Ibae0008d0a3473311decee198d518f14385a72ff

commit_message:
Switch to use stestr for unit test

According to Openstack summit session [1], stestr is maintained project
to which all Openstack projects should migrate.  So we should switch to
stestr.

This has the side effect of no longer reporting coverage by default for
unit tests. This isn't a big deal given that we have a 'cover' target
for just this purpose.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: I85545c7b4c410c310026911448a7c3847c665afb

commit_message:
[glossary] Add Stein

Add Stein as release. Change older release names to use past tense
instead of future. Fix design summit to OpenStack summit.

Note I used past tense for Stein so - so that we don't forget to update
it.

Change-Id: Id4426d3dfac9d5e62202105e982f62be07a7b27a

commit_message:
Release model for stable libraries

Following the discussion at the Denver PTG about simplifying the
process for feature-complete, superstable OpenStack libraries,
update the documentation to mention the possibility of transitioning
to an independent model.

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2018-September/135206.html

Change-Id: I66ee74a1c57abadd5f759a95a5a643378dd79a4a
Task: 26444

under the doc/source tree.

commit_message:
Handle rbd.OSError on broken RBD image

With Rocky, cinder-volume began to fail again with another error type.
This patch adds rbd.OSError type for exception block of
_get_usage_info method.

Change-Id: I93b8afeddae18d098fe926a3219811cc8c8d9b63
Closes-Bug: 1698786

Awesome!'}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-09-29 07:20:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@Shintaro: As I said during Denver PTG, there is currently Japanese translation in Operation Guide repository and Frank (I18n PTL) wants to sync translation files. Please express your opinion :)

Operator Guide cores: This patch does not affect on existing documentation but adds translation sync with https://translate.openstack.org/iteration/view/operations-guide/master , where translators can contribute translation so that translated operator guides are available through web pages. After merging this patch, I think Frank will change current abandoned status on Zanata to writable status.'}, {'account_id': 7401, 'date': '2018-10-01 01:17:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you Ian, I'm happy to help start this work. I will ask Japanese ops community to help translate. I believe there should be some people who helped the current version.

One question: Do translators get AUC/ATC status by helping this work? This would motivate people to jump in."}, {'account_id': 17765, 'date': '2018-10-02 16:29:58.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

It's already setup with new master branch in Zanata. And it seems docs cores are now included in osop-core - so pls +2A, Ian, to make a little bit progress :-)"}, {'account_id': 14482, 'date': '2018-10-04 00:04:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

> One question: Do translators get AUC/ATC status by helping this

Yep - it was discussed during last PTG and UC kindly agreed with getting AUC status for translating operator guide [1]. I18n team currently does not know when AUC nomination period starts and finished and the script extracting such information is not ready right now [2] but this can be easily dealt with I18n team :)


[1] http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/meetings/uc/2018/uc.2018-10-01-18.02.html

[{'created': '2018-10-25 18:36:01.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up comment style and identify bugs and workarounds

Cleans up the comment style to remove author names and clarify
the comment as it relates to the code. Using the NOTE (NAME):
format is redundant and takes away attention from the purpose
of documenting why an action is being taken.

Also updates status of TODO and FIXME items, including removing
code was a workaround fixed by a recent patch.

Change-Id: I2e087be1e204c618d1dbe499b3f69eae34ce656f
'}]
owner_name: Chris Hoge (not involved in upstream development)
commit_message:
Clean up comment style and identify bugs and workarounds

Cleans up the comment style to remove author names and clarify
the comment as it relates to the code. Using the NOTE (NAME):
format is redundant and takes away attention from the purpose
of documenting why an action is being taken.

Also updates status of TODO and FIXME items, including removing
code was a workaround fixed by a recent patch.

Change-Id: I2e087be1e204c618d1dbe499b3f69eae34ce656f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-11 04:45:22.000000000', 'message': 'Sharing hypervisor /var/lib/ironic with ironic-conductor container

While puppet-config generation, ironic-conductor will call ironic::pxe
to copy files and create directories required for tftpboot and httpboot
to /varlib/ironic on container.

But /var/lib/ironic of hypervisor is not being shared with ironic-conductor,
the changes that were done on container are not present on hypervisor.

For ironic-inspector the previously generated configs are required to move
forward and apply its own puppet-configs.

In order to make the configs generated by ironic-conductor available to
ironic-inspector, hypervisor /var/lib/ironic must be shared with
ironic-conductor container as well while generating puppet-config.

Change-Id: I5ee1a78ea7b7681e0dc1387fc5af598919ecb397
Closes-Bug: 1795776
'}]
commit_message:
Sharing hypervisor /var/lib/ironic with ironic-conductor container

While puppet-config generation, ironic-conductor will call ironic::pxe
to copy files and create directories required for tftpboot and httpboot
to /varlib/ironic on container.

But /var/lib/ironic of hypervisor is not being shared with ironic-conductor,
the changes that were done on container are not present on hypervisor.

For ironic-inspector the previously generated configs are required to move
forward and apply its own puppet-configs.

In order to make the configs generated by ironic-conductor available to
ironic-inspector, hypervisor /var/lib/ironic must be shared with
ironic-conductor container as well while generating puppet-config.

Change-Id: I5ee1a78ea7b7681e0dc1387fc5af598919ecb397
Closes-Bug: 1795776

commit_message:
Remove cgroup natty or less block

Given that Natty and other releases that don't use cgroups have been out
of support in Ubuntu for years now, it's high time we removed the
special case code block that sets up the cgroup mount.

Change-Id: I5403a4b1b64a95236b4dfcb66c35c594a3460cca

by a compute host

[{'created': '2018-11-02 07:04:56.000000000', 'message': 'Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to

commit_message:
Drop deprecated Telemetry services from custom roles_data.

Next services were removed in Queens:
  - OS::TripleO::Services::CeilometerApi
  - OS::TripleO::Services::CeilometerCollector
  - OS::TripleO::Services::CeilometerExpirer
and have to be removed from custom roles_data.yaml file.

Change-Id: Ic0e203fae34de816845f7f965aaf3584900ea20a

Noting that both vms were powered on:

It looks like there may be a race condition between the node being added the iptables pxe filter. Note the IP address that has been assigned is not in the neutron allocation pool:

http://logs.openstack.org/15/607315/5/check/kayobe-overcloud-centos/c0c9a60/primary/system_logs/tenks/tk1-console.txt.gz

It seems have been assigned an IP from the DHCP server in the ironic_dnsmasq container.

I suggest we put in a sleep to tip the race in the favour of the PXE filter. We could examine the iptables output, but this is specific to using the iptables pxe filter driver.'}, {'account_id': 28048, 'date': '2018-11-01 14:21:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

locked down. We need to punch some holes for things to
work correctly.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 06:14:26.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755
(cherry picked from commit e0e8a1ea68bcc33d1a07361102eb87d0cfdd94a9)
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "rabbit: Don't prefetch when batch_size is set"

This reverts commit c881baed29db49c5710795496cb07907e35ceaba.

Eventhough batch_size is set, rabbitMQ prefetch count is not changed
at the first time of connection creation. It works only connection reset
cases(i.e. rabbitMQ restart). So this patch can not fix original issue
  https://bugs.launchpad.net/ceilometer/+bug/1551667

Moreover, it makes another bug that messages of sameple queues are not
consumed properly. So revert it.

Change-Id: Ia8ebee8e2a670e46b6a68859bc30e717bd56ed7e
Signed-off-by: Wonil Choi <wonil22.choi@samsung.com>
Closes-bug: 1759755
(cherry picked from commit e0e8a1ea68bcc33d1a07361102eb87d0cfdd94a9)

commit_message:
Pass in policy name as part of the oslopolicy-check check call

We were not passing the policy name, which made it quite hard to test
out external checks given that this is information that is passed in
there. This passes that parameter.

Change-Id: I217a6545bdf753470e08b39de2c0df08ffa1f82f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 11:25:29.000000000', 'message': 'Move tempest overrides to var at task level

* In run-v3.yaml, we have started adding tempest overrides in a list
  and it started growing which is hard to handle so we can move to
  a var with list and re-use that and it also improves the
  readability.

Change-Id: Icde2989122889be426309c36a912163f69398190
'}]
commit_message:
Move tempest overrides to var at task level

* In run-v3.yaml, we have started adding tempest overrides in a list
  and it started growing which is hard to handle so we can move to
  a var with list and re-use that and it also improves the
  readability.

Change-Id: Icde2989122889be426309c36a912163f69398190

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-11-02 13:51:04.000000000', 'message': "Avoid looping systemd_service role include

Tasks within the systemd_service role already handle looping over the
'systemd_services' list. The full list can be pre-created as passed as a
var so that the systemd_service role only needs to be included and run
once.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615185
Change-Id: I39f36d3742d0f53df61298ea31d8d5ee050df318
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid looping systemd_service role include

Tasks within the systemd_service role already handle looping over the
'systemd_services' list. The full list can be pre-created as passed as a
var so that the systemd_service role only needs to be included and run
once.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/615185
Change-Id: I39f36d3742d0f53df61298ea31d8d5ee050df318

commit_message:
WIP - podman: setup systemd dependencies

When deploying with podman, we'll use systemd to handle the container
lifecycle (start / stop), so we want to setup some soft dependencies
between containers.
This patch is a PoC for HAproxy & Keepalived containers.

Look at the paunch patch to see how it'll work:
I676e5fff3daecadba45efddff11f7afc602a50ef

blueprint podman-support
Depends-On: I8942811c210f442d3cb630721c5105b725293d29
Change-Id: I6fd485382225f36d2bca34dd29b9b34273f893f3

SELinux doesn't like that at all - I'll try to find a way to make it work without new selinux policy/module..."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-02 21:38:30.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 26.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-02 21:39:56.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Patch Set 26 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 4571, 'date': '2018-10-03 04:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-10-03 07:33:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 27:

So in order to get it working with selinux separation enabled, just add this to the container options:

security_opt: label=disable

This will allow the "podman" command launched within the container to access the host data without any issue.

Also, it might be good to ensure the user, with "user: root" as well? Or is it already ensured in docker-puppet.py?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-03 18:42:18.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 27:

ack for security_opt, thanks!
However for the user, I prefer to keep avoiding root in that case, if we can. If it doesn't work I'll update and use root."}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-03 18:49:53.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 28.'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-03 18:50:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 28: -Code-Review'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-05 14:02:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Patch Set 28 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-10-05 14:05:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 29: Workflow-1

I'll test again, now with paunch fixed to run my debug containers with podman and not docker..."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-10-08 12:59:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 31: Code-Review-1

There are apparently other mounts needed in order to be able to properly manage containers within a container with podman. Please see comment https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1602#issuecomment-427806709

I think it's pretty clear :).

Now we should check what happens in the case we first deploy with docker (meaning it will create the missing directories on the host), and then migrate to podman."}, {'account_id': 28223, 'date': '2018-10-08 13:19:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

so a working command on my test env:
podman run --rm --user root -ti --security-opt label=disable --cap-add SYS_ADMIN --net=host --uts=host  --ipc=host --pid=host -v /sys/fs/cgroup:/sys/fs/cgroup:rshared -v /etc/containers:/etc/containers:ro -v /var/lib/c
ontainers:/var/lib/containers:rw,rshared -v /var/run/libpod:/var/run/libpod:rshared,rw -v /run:/run:rshared,rw a193b10ec90b /bin/bash

Note that this command requires libseccomp + podman to be installed in the container.
Apparently podman client version *must* match between host and container.

An easy way to have that would be to bind-mount /usr/bin and /usr/libexec/podman/conmon - that way, we get exactly the same version without any doubt.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-08 15:48:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

We need to come up with requirements for podman team, for how exactly do we want those nested podman CLI working (what is shared to host and what not)'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2018-10-08 17:27:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> We need to come up with requirements for podman team, for how
 > exactly do we want those nested podman CLI working (what is shared
 > to host and what not)

for the docker tag use case we need to tag a new image. so as long as podman inside podman has a view of all images we should be good'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-09 07:56:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

> as long as podman inside podman has a view of all images we should be good

Ack. That confirms that the case is tricky and needs to be implemented in podman. Otherwise, the host podman DB state corruption is inevitable.'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-09 09:58:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

It should be safe to run podman CLI in parallel with shared /run, and /var/lib/containers state. So we should update the bind-mounts as https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1602#issuecomment-427806709 states and try that out!'}, {'account_id': 6926, 'date': '2018-10-09 13:47:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 31:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2018-11-01 12:01:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 64: Code-Review-2

Not a big fan of the complexity you are adding here. It seems like we are now "jumping through hoops" to run a simple 'docker/podman tag' command inside a container. But why do we need these to run *inside* the container?

The original intent seemed to want to guarantee that we ran these commands before step 2. See I362e6cf26fba77d3f949b7d2fc4b35a3eab9087e for example. We have other ways to guarantee this I think.

While I was okay with this using docker alone the solution here seems obfuscated. And since then the number of services we have has grown too. So why not implement a more rigidly defined "tagging" step that occurs in our architecture when using pacemaker. Then the commands could be executed via Ansible directly on the host thus avoiding the complex namespace jumping here right?'}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-01 12:14:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 65: Patch Set 64 was rebased'}, {'account_id': 360, 'date': '2018-11-01 18:44:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 65:

I've implemented a 2 phase approach. First we switch the existing 'docker tag' options so that they use deploy_steps_tasks instead of docker in docker to do the actual tagging. Then what you are trying to do here becomes a simple string modification s/docker/podman/g within the tagging operations.

Lets get buy in on that and if it works we can do all the services....

here:

I81bc48b53068c3a5ed90266a4fd3e62bfb017835

and here:

Ibd2d5cbbf439177419b3d0780c5d1434a4f77605"}, {'account_id': 3153, 'date': '2018-11-02 13:49:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

'}, {'created': '2018-09-20 19:02:46.000000000', 'message': "Support podman when tagging container for Pacemaker

For each container managed by Pacemaker:

- Add ContainerCli parameter, default to docker. Possible values:
  podman/docker
- For _image_tag containers, set them as privileged and bind-mount
  /var/lib/containers so podman can tag an image from the container
  (needed since there is no socket that podman can talk to)
- Switch 'docker tag' commands into container_cli variable and export
  this variable in updates & upgrade tasks.

Thanks to this patch, we should be able to tag images from both podman &
docker containers.

Change-Id: Ib87140676a479aae47eb7de61e1763d45e9978f3

"}, {'created': '2018-10-03 18:49:53.000000000', 'message': "Support podman when tagging container for Pacemaker

For each container managed Pacemaker:

- Add ContainerCli parameter, default to docker. Possible values:
  podman/docker
- For _image_tag containers, set them as cap=SYSADMIN and bind-mount
  /var/lib/containers so podman can tag an image from the container
  (needed since there is no socket that podman can talk to)
  Also set security_opt: label=disable.

For all services:
- Switch 'docker tag' commands into container_cli variable and export
  this variable in updates & upgrade tasks.

Thanks to this patch, we should be able to tag images from both podman &
docker containers.

Change-Id: Ib87140676a479aae47eb7de61e1763d45e9978f3

"}, {'created': '2018-10-16 16:37:10.000000000', 'message': "Support podman when tagging container for Pacemaker

For each container managed Pacemaker:

- Add ContainerCli parameter, default to docker. Possible values:
  podman/docker
- For _image_tag containers, set them as cap=SYSADMIN and security_opt
  as label=disable.
- To tag the container in the image, run the podman CLI with nsenter.
- Only mount /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:rw when Docker is
  used.

For all services:
- Switch 'docker tag' commands into container_cli variable and export
  this variable in updates & upgrade tasks.

Thanks to this patch, we should be able to tag images from both podman &
docker containers.

Change-Id: Ib87140676a479aae47eb7de61e1763d45e9978f3

- For _image_tag containers, set them as cap=[SYS_ADMIN,SYS_PTRACE] and security_opt
  as label=disable.
- To tag the container in the image, run the podman CLI with nsenter.
- Only mount /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:rw when Docker is
  used.

For all services:
- Switch 'docker tag' commands into container_cli variable and export
  this variable in updates & upgrade tasks.

Thanks to this patch, we should be able to tag images from both podman &
docker containers.

Change-Id: Ib87140676a479aae47eb7de61e1763d45e9978f3

commit_message:
Support podman when tagging container for Pacemaker

For each container that is managed by Pacemaker:

- Add ContainerCli parameter, default to docker. Possible values:
  podman/docker
- For _image_tag containers, set them as cap=[SYS_ADMIN,SYS_PTRACE] and
  security_opt as label=disable.
- To tag the container in the image, run the podman CLI with nsenter.
- Only mount /var/run/docker.sock:/var/run/docker.sock:rw when Docker is
  used.
- Run the containers with pid=host when Podman is used (for nsenter)
- Only mount /run/netns:/run/netns:shared when Podman is used.
- Remove net: host, the container doesn't need networking.

For all services:
- Switch 'docker tag' commands into container_cli variable and export
  this variable in updates & upgrade tasks.

Thanks to this patch, we should be able to tag images from both podman &
docker containers.

commit_message:
Add api tests for portgroup update

Add tests:
  test_update_portgroup_replace,
  test_update_portgroup_remove_by_key,
  test_update_portgroup_remove_collection,
  test_update_portgroup_add,
  test_update_portgroup_mixed_ops.

Related-Bug: #1618754
Change-Id: I68c13de6ddcd3b0a0d7c82a34bf62bfb4be80753

[{'created': '2018-09-30 14:25:56.000000000', 'message': 'api-ref: Change extensions updated type to updated_at

This changes the updated type to be updated_at (the updated
type is just a string whereas updated_at is iso-8601 formatted
string).

This change is consistent with:

* examples for os-extensions in API docs [0]
* Nova API docs for os-extensions [1]

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#id6
[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#id402

'}]
commit_message:
api-ref: Change extensions updated type to updated_at

This changes the updated type to be updated_at (the updated
type is just a string whereas updated_at is iso-8601 formatted
string).

This change is consistent with:

* examples for os-extensions in API docs [0]
* Nova API docs for os-extensions [1]

[0] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/block-storage/v3/index.html#id6
[1] https://developer.openstack.org/api-ref/compute/#id402

Change-Id: I806dbc66f35fd0d9209c25c35adc2d64f5b9f8ed

commit_message:
Remove source_replica info from api-ref

With the addition of schema validation and the release of cinderclient
4.0.0 we no longer accept source_replica as a volume creation parameter.
This was part of the short lived replication v1 functionality that was
removed several releases ago and never had support beyond one backend
type for one or two releases and has had no affect for quite a while
now.

Change-Id: Idd848628759884c1e637ca17dc292f776e4adf47
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Add Ironic inspector health checks

This patch add health checks for ironic_inspector container
and ironic_inspector_dnsmasq container. Inspector health is checked
using curl of the API interface and dnsmasq is checked using opened
port verification.

Partial-Bug: #1801068
Change-Id: I0bcc713d342f6388750dd9dcecf439db3c59d651
(cherry picked from commit d03c53c3e4eda9ab6ead396f2b0559bb7444b561)

commit_message:
Retry waiting for initial nova-compute with rescue

Sometimes the nova-compute service doesn't seem to be able to register
itself on its initial service start. Use a block/rescue to restart the
service so a reregistration can be attempted.

Change-Id: Ic82804cc23b89f1cd5bb3a08b74cdcbf29265345

messages: [{'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2018-09-25 19:18:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6854, 'date': '2018-09-26 08:32:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-11-01 20:37:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 21626, 'date': '2018-11-02 11:31:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:\n\nrecheck'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-25 19:18:55.000000000', 'message': 'opt in for neutron-lib consumption patches

As part of the Denver PTG [1] we decided networking related projects
that are "current" and want to receive neutron-lib consumption patches
on an on-going basis should indicate such with a well defined comment
in their requirements.txt. This allows us to easily find the list of
project to receive neutron-lib consumption patches [2] by searching for
the string.

In addition, projects opting-in for these patches are also attesting
they will stay up to date with TC and infra initiatives to ensure
consumption patches can flow freely.

This patch adds the "neutron-lib-current" string to requirements.txt
opting in for neutron-lib consumption patches.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-stein-ptg
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/contributing.html#phase-4-consume

Change-Id: Iaee6784e224ce824353156a5e86e8926b56ff6b4
'}]
commit_message:
opt in for neutron-lib consumption patches

As part of the Denver PTG [1] we decided networking related projects
that are "current" and want to receive neutron-lib consumption patches
on an on-going basis should indicate such with a well defined comment
in their requirements.txt. This allows us to easily find the list of
project to receive neutron-lib consumption patches [2] by searching for
the string.

In addition, projects opting-in for these patches are also attesting
they will stay up to date with TC and infra initiatives to ensure
consumption patches can flow freely.

This patch adds the "neutron-lib-current" string to requirements.txt
opting in for neutron-lib consumption patches.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-stein-ptg
[2] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron-lib/latest/contributor/contributing.html#phase-4-consume

Change-Id: Iaee6784e224ce824353156a5e86e8926b56ff6b4

commit_message:
Update the min version of tox to 2.0

The verification comands used by tox need at least 2.0 version. This
patch aims to update tox version from 1.6 to 2.0 which should help with
local running of constraints targets.

Change-Id: Ida5673ee66ab320975ead2d518df4f27c07b6d77

commit_message:
changed port in argument '--bootstrap-admin-url'

Before keystone needed to be run on two separate ports to accommodate
the Identity v2 API which ran a separate admin-only service commonly
on port 35357. With the removal of the v2 API, keystone runs on port
5000.

Change-Id: I7744f664a9477430fb350889dc46cdf63dee17f9

commit_message:
Allow basic auth in netloc_no_port filtered URLs

Update the netloc_no_port filter to parse a URL using the 'hostname'
attribute instead of splitting the netloc before the first colon, where
a username might be provided.

Change-Id: I9a0d01eac1e44de121fc7c6753cfa1bc2ed4318d
(cherry picked from commit 83c5785ba8737e9d0a17ff62afa2e13c72d531ed)

commit_message:
Make glance cache management cron task idempotent

Use a seed in the glance cache management cron task's random
filter so that each host's results are idempotent when re-running.
This prevents the constant changing of the crontab whenever the
playbook is run.

Change-Id: Ia14e867347aeadc6c55cef49f9f2ae0e6f86412f
(cherry picked from commit 2bb196613dd45d23ae7a067ec98f2867d631a5e6)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 19:07:40.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unnecessary package install duplication

Currently the devel packages are installed everywhere,
but they only need to be where the wheels are built.

Also, there is already a task to install the packages
needed on the target hosts when installing - so we do
not need to give the same list to the venv install role
because they will already have been installed.

Change-Id: Iab434e8c91463d9b0c34eba23b0550fa2af46481
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unnecessary package install duplication

Currently the devel packages are installed everywhere,
but they only need to be where the wheels are built.

Also, there is already a task to install the packages
needed on the target hosts when installing - so we do
not need to give the same list to the venv install role
because they will already have been installed.

Change-Id: Iab434e8c91463d9b0c34eba23b0550fa2af46481

commit_message:
use common rpc and exceptions from neutron-lib

The neutron.common.rpc and exceptions were rehomed into neutron-lib and
are currently shimmed in neutron [1]

This patch consumes those modules from neutron-lib by using lib's
modules rather than neutrons.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/586525/

Change-Id: I09b806ff67f4f5bb9513f6696d87f63d797e94f8

commit_message:
add local tox targets for pep8 and py3

This patch adds local tox targets for pep8 and python 3 as per [1]
that will install dependencies in editable mode.
To run them use the pep8-dev and py3-dev targets respectively.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/neutron-sibling-setup

Change-Id: I1ef1c509576c7500ab840362700d700768613b3a

subject: DNM: Demonstrate online migrations
messages:
[{'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-29 21:17:40.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-10-30 09:27:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1

Clearly some issues here with configure being called on the transaction too much:

http://logs.openstack.org/30/614030/1/check/openstack-tox-functional/3716c30/testr_results.html.gz'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2018-11-02 10:50:50.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

this has served its demo purpose'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-29 21:17:40.000000000', 'message': 'DNM: Demonstrate online migrations

If the "online" section of env.py is set up to properly find the oslo
configuration, it is possible to autogenerate a new revision:

* establish a placement.conf with a database connection string
* create that database 'mysqladmin create placement'
* use alembic to bring it up to date:

    .tox/py36/bin/alembic -c placement/db/sqlalchemy/alembic.ini upgrade head

* modify the models files in api_models.py
* create a new revision:

    .tox/py36/bin/alembic -c placement/db/sqlalchemy/alembic.ini revision --autogenerate

* verify and tweak the resulting file

We don't have to use this, but it might be handy in some cases, and
having "online" working properly seems like the right way to go.

Change-Id: I30e766a0492bca1ba453b44bf174782c93e8cbef
'}]
commit_message:
DNM: Demonstrate online migrations

If the "online" section of env.py is set up to properly find the oslo
configuration, it is possible to autogenerate a new revision:

* establish a placement.conf with a database connection string
* create that database 'mysqladmin create placement'
* use alembic to bring it up to date:

    .tox/py36/bin/alembic -c placement/db/sqlalchemy/alembic.ini upgrade head

* modify the models files in api_models.py
* create a new revision:

    .tox/py36/bin/alembic -c placement/db/sqlalchemy/alembic.ini revision --autogenerate

* verify and tweak the resulting file

We don't have to use this, but it might be handy in some cases, and
having "online" working properly seems like the right way to go.

Change-Id: I30e766a0492bca1ba453b44bf174782c93e8cbef

commit_message:
Fix Undercloud masquerading firewall rules

Iterate over destination for each source to have the
correct return rules created. (Passing a list as
destination to tripleo::firewall::rule does not work.)

Also the "forward destinations" rules should use the
source addresses in the data for both source and
destination rules.

Change-Id: I3d572bf4aab65f5befb596f7c90c94fc0abe7afa
Closes-Bug: #1797455

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-25 10:18:05.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Don't run host_prep_tasks from {{role}}HostPrepDeployment"

{{role}}HostPrepDeployment resources are still needed in queens as config-download is not the default deployment procedure. Therefore, if config-download is not used we would skip the host_prep_tasks, which are needed for several services to work correctly (i.e: nova-compute as stated in LP 1799903)

This reverts commit 3ce99b522ca99250560c5cc135125fcbeb943515.

Change-Id: I2cd06a7f261d3587bb50683ae2b54631983ea077
Closes-Bug: #1799903
'}, {'created': '2018-10-25 14:25:10.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "Don't run host_prep_tasks from {{role}}HostPrepDeployment"

{{role}}HostPrepDeployment resources are still needed in queens as
config-download is not the default deployment procedure. Therefore,
if config-download is not used we would skip the host_prep_tasks,
which are needed for several services to work correctly (i.e:
nova-compute as stated in LP 1799903)

This reverts commit 3ce99b522ca99250560c5cc135125fcbeb943515.

Change-Id: I2cd06a7f261d3587bb50683ae2b54631983ea077
Closes-Bug: #1799903
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Don't run host_prep_tasks from {{role}}HostPrepDeployment"

{{role}}HostPrepDeployment resources are still needed in queens as
config-download is not the default deployment procedure. Therefore,
if config-download is not used we would skip the host_prep_tasks,
which are needed for several services to work correctly (i.e:
nova-compute as stated in LP 1799903)

This reverts commit 3ce99b522ca99250560c5cc135125fcbeb943515.

Change-Id: I2cd06a7f261d3587bb50683ae2b54631983ea077
Closes-Bug: #1799903

commit_message:
Wait for disk when attaching volumes

It might take some time to discover new device in guest OS.
This patch adds waiter for device after we attached volume.

Change-Id: I1d35f6ed94fcd152a63f61ef6e073bc7fff40daa
Related-Prod: PROD-21942

commit_message:
Create default deployment plan

Currently no default plan is created during a container-based undercloud
deployment.

This patch creates a default deployment plan if both of two conditions
apply:
- The /usr/share/openstack-tripleo-heat-templates directory exists
  (We need the templates to create the plan)
- There is no container named `overcloud` in swift yet
  (If a deployment is run more than once we don't want to recreate
  the default plan)

Closes-Bug: #1798590

Change-Id: Id03631432b1fedd75ee3ddba67bfe7d5d6049a07

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 21:10:27.000000000', 'message': 'Start rabbitmq service when config is in place

rabbitmq is started three times:

1st time in rabbitmq_install with default config
2nd time in rabbitmq_set_cookie with default config
3rd time in rabbitmq_post_install with OSA config

however, there is no need for that and we can remove the 1st one and
the 2nd as it uses a default config which might break deployments
(e.g. if number of threads is limited through cgroups)

Change-Id: Iaef3b91d2a555bf0681f4a7d018d6d93e93889b4
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}, {'created': '2018-10-30 21:12:27.000000000', 'message': 'Start rabbitmq service when config is in place

rabbitmq is started three times:

1st time in rabbitmq_install with default config
2nd time in rabbitmq_set_cookie with default config
3rd time in rabbitmq_post_install with OSA config

however, there is no need for that and we can remove the 1st one and
the 2nd as it uses a default config which might break deployments
(e.g. if number of threads is limited through cgroups)

Change-Id: Iaef3b91d2a555bf0681f4a7d018d6d93e93889b4
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Start rabbitmq service when config is in place

rabbitmq is started three times:

1st time in rabbitmq_install with default config
2nd time in rabbitmq_set_cookie with default config
3rd time in rabbitmq_post_install with OSA config

however, there is no need for that and we can remove the 1st one and
the 2nd as it uses a default config which might break deployments
(e.g. if number of threads is limited through cgroups)

Change-Id: Iaef3b91d2a555bf0681f4a7d018d6d93e93889b4
Signed-off-by: Manuel Buil <mbuil@suse.com>

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I38e04cf7d06e26667913097786b84f85349cf18f

commit_message:
Allow specify Ceph upgrade workarounds.

So far we are missing mechanism to apply workarounds(if needed)
pre- and post-upgrade of ceph cluster.

Change-Id: I5b7333d9bfb8954b3c52c66edc1090a8bd7dac17

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: Idb7268d350a63715e0b1f3a430046ac53bc811bd

commit_message:
Retire instack-undercloud

instack-undercloud is no longer in use by the TripleO project. Removing
the code to avoid confusion. Stable branches will continue to be
maintained for their life however no new features should be added.

Change-Id: I63a813c7c1ffd30ca30017133d31a497b77a9a4d
Blueprint: remove-instack-undercloud

commit_message:
Enable undercloud_enable_tempest to true for FS01

* Since tempest is runned using tempest container so
  undercloud_enable_tempest is set to be true so that it will enable
  tempest in undercloud.conf and pull tempest container on undercloud
  registry and reuse it from there while running it.

Closes-Bug: #1800682
Change-Id: I75e641942b6467ed7a7266d0c32e3e6ce8603a00

commit_message:
Add parameters for cinder storage availability zones

Add CinderStorageAvailabilityZone parameter that configures
cinder's DEFAULT/storage_availability_zone. The default value
of 'nova' matches cinder's own default value.

Add several CinderXXXAvailabilityZone parameters, where XXX is
any of the cinder volume service's storage backends. The
parameters are optional, and when set they override the
"backend_availability_zone" for the corresponding backend.

Implements: blueprint split-controlplane-cinder-volume-az
Depends-On: Ic407b747474b567858ad36beabc8a7d8c5022343
Change-Id: Idb035bf112cbab41547bd89935df4c175bf665f4

commit_message:
Use undercloud_enable_tempest for fs035 and fs053

* Since tempest is runned using tempest container so undercloud_enable_tempest
  is set to be true so that it will enable tempest in undercloud.conf and pull
  tempest container on undercloud registry and reuse it from there while running it.
* Fixed table of content for tempest-setup in these FS

* https://tree.taiga.io/project/tripleo-ci-board/issue/306

Change-Id: I81255f8b400f7be96f61ce12baed19a874b75d77
Closes-Bug: #1800682

[{'account_id': 29422, 'date': '2018-11-02 08:09:05.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-11-02 08:09:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
and resubmit a new change-set.

Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
Workflow: https://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html

commit_message:
Switch to stestr

According to Openstack summit session [1],
stestr is maintained project to which all Openstack projects should migrate.
Let's switch to stestr as other projects have already moved to it.

[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/YVR-python-pti

Change-Id: Ief9d6d2a875a518b2506ea217e5fd0c95d8486f5

commit_message:
Stop using docker.yaml after it was deprecated

In Stein we are deprecating docker.yaml, it's not necessary
anymore. Stop using it unless we're deploying Rocky or older.

Change-Id: I74acdf3b6a5fe7c67371895a836cf7f72e7d7ea5

low-memory-usage: configure NovaSchedulerWorkers to 1

Like other Nova services, let's reduce the number of workers of Nova
Scheduler to 1.

Change-Id: I5fd418a263a70e7d64a676d5b8ab3c49ad8557f9

commit_message:
docker-puppet: remove -z from /var/lib/config-data mount

Context: https://github.com/containers/libpod/issues/1739
The relabeling of /var/lib/config-data fails with Podman and since we
run the docker-puppet containers with label=disable, we shouldn't need
to relabel it anyway.

Change-Id: I5e0715a9b7a052126fb01c8d2c3da36a38bec2bf
Related-Bug: #1800737

commit_message:
Split designate envs

Because the designate parameters will always need to be edited for
a deployment, a copy of the environment must be made.  However,
because there were resource_registry entries in the previous
enable-designate environments those relative paths would become
invalid if the file was moved.  Splitting the resource_registry
entries from the user-configured parameters should eliminate this
problem.

Change-Id: I8817a36e20e7a75b340a0d6cb0abf09e57b1fd63

commit_message:
Skip hosts group in ceph-ansible inventory when all are blacklisted

Ensures the hosts group is not created in the ceph-ansible inventory
if all nodes of a given group are blacklisted.

Closes-Bug: 1798044
Change-Id: Ibf25e28d02cee6308f3e9a2660e001ba73d756c0
(cherry picked from commit 5bcfb7114666efc0172132a4ebe0f5cff2be7931)

commit_message:
update aodh notifier when there're multiple regions

When there're multiple regions in openstack system, like 'regionOne' and
'regionTwo', aodh do not specify a region to get the endpoint of zaqar.

An endpoint url should be uniquely determined by 'service_id','interface',
'region_id'.

Closes-Bug: #1798033
Change-Id: I5b8d279d7ce08b165002422c07792f59f1e9912f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-05-09 18:10:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add redeploy role

This new role can be used to redeploy an overcloud to execute
configuration changes. Users pass in a list of environment files
containing all the required configuration changes.

In addition, tasks are provided for one particular type of
configuration change: generation of new passwords.  Users can
define new passwords in the environment files passed in, or they
can pass in a list of passwords to be generated.

Change-Id: Ibcb3a41b040953aeea3001cccddef0290ad5df7c

containing all the required configuration changes.

In addition, tasks are provided for one particular type of
configuration change: generation of new passwords.  Users can
define new passwords in the environment files passed in, or they

In addition, tasks are provided for one particular type of

commit_message:
Add config_change role

This new role can be used to apply a configuration change on the
overcloud by re-running the overcloud-deploy script with new
environment files to specify the config changes.

Users pass in a list of environment files containing all the
required configuration changes.

In addition, tasks are provided for one particular type of
configuration change: generation of new passwords.  Users can
define new passwords in the environment files passed in, or they
can pass in a list of passwords to be generated.  To enable this,
set overcloud_generate_passwords to true.

To use this role, we expect the parameter overcloud_config_change
to be set to true.  In tripleo-ci, we will search for that value,
and if set, add the overcloud-config-change tags to the ansible
tasks to be run.

If config_change_noop is also set to true, we will create, but not
execute the relevant scripts.

Change-Id: Ibcb3a41b040953aeea3001cccddef0290ad5df7c

commit_message:
WIP - Register controller nodes

There are actions to be executed depending
if they need to be executed on controller nodes or not.

This stores the controllers list based on the
role installing the haproxy service.

Note: This won't work until https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1542871
is fixed.

Change-Id: I9b4a8a1db586991186d2266b7536ccef8b5c24f1

Add py36 testenv

Python 3.6 is installed by default in Ubuntu 18.04 LTS.
Therefore, according to transition plan [1],
we should have py36 testenv ready for it.

[1] https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Python/Python36Transition

commit_message:
Add memcache flushing handler on db migrations

Flushing cache when schema changes occur to avoid drift between
what might be cached and what keystone queries expect.

Given that this is a workaround which is only usually required
in major upgrades (and should really be handled in process by
keystone itself), we make the execution optional so that it can
be set to happen only on major upgrades.

To prevent test breakage as happened in master, we combine the
two master patches into one for the backport:

https://review.openstack.org/608066
https://review.openstack.org/613256

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/613290
Change-Id: Ibf8f3dd60d6f3c446a14dc8228fa005f12fcc840
Closes-Bug: 1793389

subject: Remove race between sync_pools and other pool actions
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 11600, 'name': 'Michał Dulko', 'email': 'mdulko@redhat.com', 'username': 'dulek'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}, {'_account_id': 14885, 'name': 'Daniel Mellado', 'email': 'dmellado@redhat.com', 'username': 'daniel-mellado'}, {'_account_id': 21041, 'name': 'Yossi Boaron', 'email': 'yossi.boaron.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'yboaron'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 23567, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:14:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-10-30 15:44:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 21041, 'date': '2018-10-31 07:44:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hi Luis,
I'm not familiar with port pool details, but I have thoughts/questions that I would like to share with u.

IIUC, the reason for that is that _return_ports_to_pool activities start in the pool_vif driver Ctor (service init), while the 'sync_pools' being called only at service start.

Q: In case of a standby controller, we should always see this ERRORs, is it correct?

Q: If the answer to the previous Q is True, maybe we can consider adding some sync mechanism(something similar to binary semaphore) at [2], so the _return_ports_to_pool loop will run only if controller completes his start phase.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/vif_pool.py#L144
[2] https://github.com/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes/blob/master/kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/vif_pool.py#L333"}, {'account_id': 14352, 'date': '2018-11-02 08:06:40.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-30 15:14:32.000000000', 'message': 'Remove race between sync_pools and other pool actions

This patch ensures that no actions are done on the pools
while they have not been yet initialized, i.e., make them
wait for the kuryr-controller to be ready

Closes-Bug: 1800491
Change-Id: I9a074a1911f062557ed642d84af6165d01558a69
(cherry picked from commit ee626d839d46c0c19d6482d783420463a80ac1ba)
'}]
commit_message:
Remove race between sync_pools and other pool actions

This patch ensures that no actions are done on the pools
while they have not been yet initialized, i.e., make them
wait for the kuryr-controller to be ready

Closes-Bug: 1800491
Change-Id: I9a074a1911f062557ed642d84af6165d01558a69
(cherry picked from commit ee626d839d46c0c19d6482d783420463a80ac1ba)

commit_message:
Explicitly convert X-Target-Insecure to a boolean

We will now only accept the string values "False" or "True". Previously
any given value was interpreted as a string and thus True.

Closes-Bug: #1666565
Change-Id: Ibd105c881dbe16cd4516bfb775c8f5f43c961b45

Change-Id: I4bd05ee8db9ed944edd7942a1a7aef0de0ab07f0

commit_message:
Do not wipe disks on OpenShift gluster nodes

This operation is dangerous and should be done by the operator prior to
deploying openshift. We assume the disks are ready for glusterfs
installation.

Change-Id: I4bd05ee8db9ed944edd7942a1a7aef0de0ab07f0
(cherry picked from commit 4f2677ffbb36ec615d0dc28ae849851020cd8b6b)

commit_message:
Set openshift_docker_insecure_registries

This variable is used in the docker_image_availability check to
determine how to query the registries for image availability. Setting
this variable allows us to enable the docker_image_availability check
in the gate.

Change-Id: Ia1da542d342228bb28ad487371fad8d3ffc62d0b
(cherry picked from commit cbac4c43737aa520ed91e78659d749badb72968d)

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-26 12:19:22.000000000', 'message': 'Fix non iSCSI attach serialization

When the shared_targets concept was introduced it defaulted to True for
any driver not reporting that capability.  This meant that the
attachment of all volumes would be serialized even if they have no
concept of a "shared target".

This is caused because that feature was intended for iSCSI connections,
but was applied to all connection types, introducing an unnecessary
bottleneck on drivers like RBD or FC.

This patch makes sure to check that the storage_protocol is also iSCSI.

Closes-Bug: #1800136
Change-Id: I2805e8acf560cb941ddd3454477d89fe5a13d37f
'}]
commit_message:
Fix non iSCSI attach serialization

When the shared_targets concept was introduced it defaulted to True for
any driver not reporting that capability.  This meant that the
attachment of all volumes would be serialized even if they have no
concept of a "shared target".

This is caused because that feature was intended for iSCSI connections,
but was applied to all connection types, introducing an unnecessary
bottleneck on drivers like RBD or FC.

This patch makes sure to check that the storage_protocol is also iSCSI.

Closes-Bug: #1800136
Change-Id: I2805e8acf560cb941ddd3454477d89fe5a13d37f

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-23 06:04:50.000000000', 'message': 'Do not modify imagestreams

The `openshift_examples_modify_imagestreams` ansible variable controls
whether openshift-ansible changes the imagestream registry hosts to be
the same as where the openshift images are pulled. In our case this
points to the container image registry on the undercloud by default.

However, due to how this feature was implemented in openshift-ansible
[1], the imagestreams are only modified when the original value is
registry.redhat.com, i.e. when deploying openshift-enterprise,
explaining why this issue remained unnoticed until now.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/blob/95bc2d2e61f23bfc81e1160ad7fc0a8ffef6c2d9/roles/openshift_examples/tasks/main.yml#L52-L55

Change-Id: I4949f53e966872f775833b8d36d96ef72cf13845
(cherry picked from commit a17b245049291ad33c65b3a2dcee330d9a8c0517)
'}]
commit_message:
Do not modify imagestreams

The `openshift_examples_modify_imagestreams` ansible variable controls
whether openshift-ansible changes the imagestream registry hosts to be
the same as where the openshift images are pulled. In our case this
points to the container image registry on the undercloud by default.

However, due to how this feature was implemented in openshift-ansible
[1], the imagestreams are only modified when the original value is
registry.redhat.com, i.e. when deploying openshift-enterprise,
explaining why this issue remained unnoticed until now.

[1] https://github.com/openshift/openshift-ansible/blob/95bc2d2e61f23bfc81e1160ad7fc0a8ffef6c2d9/roles/openshift_examples/tasks/main.yml#L52-L55

Change-Id: I4949f53e966872f775833b8d36d96ef72cf13845
(cherry picked from commit a17b245049291ad33c65b3a2dcee330d9a8c0517)

commit_message:
Add systemd-containers functional tests

Add functional tests for the Ubuntu systemd-container elements
introduced with I45651de2aa1b19bdeee301094f0bdffdd0a3b45c

These test the Xenial and Bionic guest images build on Xenial and
Bionic hosts.  I'm not sure it's worth the gate resources to also do
this on CentOS/Trusty at this point, so they're left out.

Change-Id: Ie9da9e22f5421999ac96750624f7d53bb0aa6160

commit_message:
Let openshift-ansible configure the firewall

Openshift-ansible already sets the right firewall rules on the
provisioned nodes, there is no need to set up (some of) the rules by
ourselves.

Add the 'OS::TripleO::Services::TripleoFirewall' to all the OpenShift
roles so that the operator can still set additional rules if desired.

Change-Id: I1e8ca10069c3f1017207abfebb803cb7aa3835a8
(cherry picked from commit 26c108b1746bf4d6e0199e6a13bb121a835c5a96)

[{'created': '2018-09-29 15:04:09.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I360fc2d49b9e737fd36442ac291a1f532f98b3e7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I360fc2d49b9e737fd36442ac291a1f532f98b3e7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

It doesn't help that the neutron upgrade docs are quite unclear. What they need is a step by step process for each of the upgrade types (downtime, rolling).

I think we need to do this:

* Run DB expand
* Check for offline migrations
* If offline migrations, stop neutron servers
* If no offline migrations, restart neutron servers with new code
* Run DB contract
* If offline migrations, start neutron servers with new code

As I mentioned in my comments, that might be quite fiddly to achieve, so this would probably be acceptable:

* Run DB expand
* Check for offline migrations
* Restart neutron servers with new code
* If offline migrations, stop neutron servers
* Run DB contract
* If offline migrations, start neutron servers"}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-08-31 09:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-09-04 03:40:55.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 42:

(4 comments)

> (3 comments)
 > 
 > Sorry, I changed my mind - I don't think this is right.
 > 
 > It doesn't help that the neutron upgrade docs are quite unclear.
 > What they need is a step by step process for each of the upgrade
 > types (downtime, rolling).
 > 
 > I think we need to do this:
 > 
 > * Run DB expand
 > * Check for offline migrations
 > * If offline migrations, stop neutron servers
 > * If no offline migrations, restart neutron servers with new code
 > * Run DB contract
 > * If offline migrations, start neutron servers with new code
 > 
 > As I mentioned in my comments, that might be quite fiddly to
 > achieve, so this would probably be acceptable:
 > 
 > * Run DB expand
 > * Check for offline migrations
 > * Restart neutron servers with new code
 > * If offline migrations, stop neutron servers
 > * Run DB contract
 > * If offline migrations, start neutron servers

Hi Mark, thank for your big comment. That's my fault.

I've checked it out and updated the logic. It has one different
with your comment, that is:

* Run DB expand
* Restart neutron services with new code
* Check for offline migrations
* If offline migrations, stop neutron servers

I think we should run the check task for offline migrations on new neutron-server services. Because the command "has_offline_migrations" need run on new neutron code to check if there is any contract revision not applied to database, then we should shut down all neutron-server instances before proceeding with contract phase.'}, {'account_id': 28176, 'date': '2018-09-04 03:45:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 43.'}, {'account_id': 14826, 'date': '2018-09-04 08:03:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 43:

commit_message:
Apply Neutron rolling upgrade logic

This patchset implements Neutron rolling upgrade logic as described
in [1].

Due to only neutron, vpnass and fwaas have supported for rolling upgrade
database migration, so I used the list "neutron_rolling_upgrade_services"
in neutron/default/main.yml for contain there services.

[1] https://docs.openstack.org/neutron/latest/contributor/internals/upgrade.html

Co-author: Ha Manh Dong <donghm@vn.fujitsu.com>
Change-Id: I2ed2f941d30d4df0d0f42c0d10e7ca03ec1c166a
Implements: blueprint apply-service-upgrade-procedure

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0. Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-09-29 15:02:39.000000000', 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic34183ed3ea23c8151909da52498c3f6b44c5c2a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic34183ed3ea23c8151909da52498c3f6b44c5c2a
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Verify port_forwarding subnet and IP address both

Free subnet can not remove from router if other router's
subnets have port_forwarding. This patch fixed it by
checking the router interface subnet and IP address.

Co-Authored-By: LIU Yulong <i@liuyulong.me>
Closes-Bug: #1799140
Change-Id: Idace35126bb00139fa1f9f48be3aa3aab265b9d8

subject: Changed README.md to complete first onboarding task.
messages:
[{'account_id': 29340, 'date': '2018-10-21 07:09:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10068, 'date': '2018-10-21 07:09:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Thank you for your first contribution to OpenStack.

    Your patch will now be tested automatically by OpenStack testing frameworks
    and once the automatic tests pass, it will be reviewed by other friendly
    developers. They will give you feedback and may require you to refine it.

    People seldom get their patch approved on the first try, so don't be
    concerned if requested to make corrections. Feel free to modify your patch
    and resubmit a new change-set.

    Patches usually take 3 to 7 days to be reviewed so be patient and be
    available on IRC to ask and answer questions about your work. Also it
    takes generally at least a couple of weeks for cores to get around to
    reviewing code. The more you participate in the community the more
    rewarding it is for you. You may also notice that the more you get to know
    people and get to be known, the faster your patches will be reviewed and
    eventually approved. Get to know others and become known by doing code
    reviews: anybody can do it, and it's a great way to learn the code base.

    Thanks again for supporting OpenStack, we look forward to working with you.

    IRC: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/IRC
    Workflow: http://docs.openstack.org/infra/manual/developers.html
    Commit Messages: https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/GitCommitMessages"}, {'account_id': 8556, 'date': '2018-10-24 06:56:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Thanks for contribution and interest in openastack. You might try the onboarding or practice patches in sandbox repo
- https://github.com/openstack-dev/sandbox

There you can push any kind of practice patches. This is working repo and these type of practice patches are not suitable in this repo. 

Thanks. Reach out to First Contact SIG for any kind of further help- https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/First_Contact_SIG'}, {'account_id': 13686, 'date': '2018-11-02 06:26:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1

Congratulations! -1 as the actual content added is not something we would land in it's current form :)"}, {'account_id': 29340, 'date': '2018-11-02 07:47:47.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This was just a gerrit test.'}]

Change-Id: I15058db3e6dc4baf7f223a96fd083c21b1e905d9
'}]

commit_message:
Clarify resource deprecation process

The deprecation process is unclear in that it does not specify the goals of
hiding (rather than removing) obsolete resource types. This has led to
resources being hidden without removing their implementation, leaving
existing stacks potentially inoperable.

State clearly the purpose of hidden resource types, and options available
to help users migrate.

Change-Id: I7362c094122066f98a5c95d4c5da16cb5a5c1108

commit_message:
Add timeout to openstack command

There are cases when udercloud is not ready. This causes 'openstack' cli to
hang which is not good in case of ansible check. This patch adds timeout to
kill the process, then will cause ansible to retry the command again instead of
hang.

Change-Id: Ifaeff772a0c95ddb4d39c0a7b6fdd56a6abb023b

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I31c80fdb4865f754330047e8c7d97698cf29f94f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I32101f062a4f194a340fe678812c12c157448d8f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2f4357b4168a1142950f12304932d8f559f380fb
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Retire instack

instack is no longer in use by the TripleO project. Removing the code to
avoid confusion. Stable branches will continue to be maintained for
their life however no new features should be added.

Change-Id: I70a749490b74d2ebb8a318854490e0a355e55920
Blueprint: remove-instack-undercloud

Matt's point was that we can still merge this nearly like it is, but by always passing the "don't do the new thing" flag. Then in the version that adds the microversion, you can change the "always false" flag to check the microversion.

'}, {'created': '2018-08-14 13:00:15.000000000', 'message': 'Return a minimal construct for nova list when a cell is down

This patch modifies the existing behavior of nova list which
ignores a down cell to returning a partial construct consisting of
uuid, project_id and created_at fields obtained from the API
instance_mappings table for the instances in the down cell by
introducing a new API microversion. This way when the user
gets partial results for certain records, he/she will know
that that particular cell is unreachable. Note that the other
keys will be missing from the API response.

Related to blueprint bp/handling-down-cell
Closes-Bug: #1726301

Change-Id: Ie9a9aed0676d469e5180d4c2d2631cf339335b2d

gets partial results for certain records, he/she will know
that that particular cell is unreachable. Note that the other
keys will be missing from the API response. Also note that this
is not externally poke-able until the microversion and API change
later in this series.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: Ie9a9aed0676d469e5180d4c2d2631cf339335b2d
'}]
commit_message:
Minimal construct plumbing for nova list when a cell is down

This patch augments the existing behavior of nova list which
ignores a down cell to returning a partial construct consisting of
uuid, project_id and created_at fields obtained from the API
instance_mappings table for the instances in the down cell by
introducing a new API microversion. This way when the user
gets partial results for certain records, he/she will know
that that particular cell is unreachable. Note that the other
keys will be missing from the API response. Also note that this
is not externally poke-able until the microversion and API change
later in this series.

Related to blueprint handling-down-cell

Change-Id: Ie9a9aed0676d469e5180d4c2d2631cf339335b2d

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-10-31 17:03:10.000000000', 'message': 'iptables-restore wait period cannot be zero

In case --wait (-w) parameter is zero, iptables-restore returns an
error.

Correct:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 1 -W 20000 ipt

Incorrect:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 0 -W 20000 ipt
  Option --wait-interval requires option --wait

Change-Id: I431fe6f637b963d61d81afed30a4fb1ec112d66c
Closes-Bug: #1800884
'}]
commit_message:
iptables-restore wait period cannot be zero

In case --wait (-w) parameter is zero, iptables-restore returns an
error.

Correct:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 1 -W 20000 ipt

Incorrect:
  [root@dev02 iptables]# iptables-restore -w 0 -W 20000 ipt
  Option --wait-interval requires option --wait

Change-Id: I431fe6f637b963d61d81afed30a4fb1ec112d66c
Closes-Bug: #1800884
